Author: kkent
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Maryland contract law allows for contract formation when there is a valid offer and acceptance (including through part performance in certain circumstances). The issue here is not of a sweepstakes nature or FTC regulations. The issue is that Authorship advertised that they would provide people with a good (ATS tokens) in exchange for a service (promotion of the ICO). Petre and the Authorship team later decided that they didn't want to pay out and simply declared the whole event over. Unfortunately for them, they had already sent out e-mails confirming that some people had completed the advertising service and were going to be paid a certain amount of ATS. To be clear, I am not referring to the e-mails that were received along the way, but rather the withdrawal confirmation e-mails that they sent out after people filled out the form on Sept 14.  Anyone who matches that specific description would potentially have a valid lawsuit against them. No scammer would have a valid lawsuit because Authorship disclosed up front that they would have a zero tolerance policy for fraudulent referrals. Petre and Authorship might have really gotten themselves in some legal troubles though with the decision to not pay out to the people who they had already sent the confirmation e-mails to.

Author: sandler425
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: They are based in the US.  In the US it is completely illegal for a company to promise something for a sweepstakes/bounty campaign and then simply refuse to pay it.  It's also illegal to guarantee the price of something like ATS will "definitely be 15 cents" but nobody is complaining about that.  Get off your fucking high horse because you have no goddamn clue about the law.  What Authorship.com has done here is COMPLETELY illegal and complaints/lawsuits will be filed accordingly.

Author: kkent
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: The bottom of their e-mails say 11015 York Road, Cockeysville MD 21030 USA  However, google maps says that is a place called Precision Tune Auto Care.... https://www.google.com/maps/place/11015+York+Rd,+Cockeysville,+MD+21030/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x89c81279781138df:0x418d7f10fb767a74?sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwja8NDB56zWAhVM6YMKHUImCaIQ8gEIJTAA  So here we have a man named Petre from Romania (he confirmed this a few pages back) who lied about his name and is promoting a company that lists an address that really belongs to an auto-repair shop. Then he changes his story multiple times about what is going on/when people will receive their payments, finally sending out an e-mail claiming that anyone who hasn't been paid is a cheater and that he will be taking a week off.  This whole thing screams SCAM louder and louder the deeper you look into it.

Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Your rude shilling is noted.  Fact is a LOT of people who just signed up for their newsletter or sent them a couple legit referrals were arbitrarily not paid out, while a lot of obvious cheaters got paid, in many cases even more than once.  Fact is Authorship zig-zagged several times, changed rules after the bounty program ended, did not communicate clearly (and when they communicated, they were arrogant, patronizing and not truthful)  Fact is Authorship demonstrated a remarkable lack of technical competence AND communication skills. Even if we decide not to call their bounty program a fake, scam and fraud, this does not bode well for the future of the project.

Author: hunnykaushal
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: They already have words with exchanges, So don't waste your time in this  :p  Exchange listing  We’d also like to announce our investors that this entire bounty situation has been discussed with several exchanges, and been told this is a general thing that happens with all ICOs bounties: you can never please everyone and cheaters are a nightmare to deal with messing things up. We are happy to have pleased 8158 token holders. Once things settle and everyone realizes that the distribution is over we’ll be submitting our listing requests as requested by several of you.  80% of the token holders are mostly authors and publishing industry members who look forward to our next year official launch. We would like to thank them all for their vote of confidence as they are an important part of the upcoming platform.

Body: Yesterday I wrote a post congratulating with the team for the successful crowdsale, and telling that I was serenely waiting for the bounty rewards.  What a mess !!! I am sure the team made a big mistake, probably granted more tokens that budgeted.  If you put 1 Million token who cares if some of them go the some multiple accounts. You still have 1 Million ATS to distribuite...  I can see here, reading hundreds of messages that many people, even with only 75 ATS didn't get their bounty....  Despite the measures taken to prevent multiple accounts (they sais that, I personally don't believe it) there are eth addresses with dozen of ATS granted transaction...Congratulations !  I promoted the bounty campaign trough twitter and telegram, and also friends which I know and have been signed up did not get their token...How can I explain this to them? Ok I will say that me and them are so stupid to believe in the Authorship team.

Author: hunnykaushal
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: This is for those who were saying that they will complaint to exchanges   Exchange listing  We’d also like to announce our investors that this entire bounty situation has been discussed with several exchanges, and been told this is a general thing that happens with all ICOs bounties: you can never please everyone and cheaters are a nightmare to deal with messing things up. We are happy to have pleased 8158 token holders. Once things settle and everyone realizes that the distribution is over we’ll be submitting our listing requests as requested by several of you.  80% of the token holders are mostly authors and publishing industry members who look forward to our next year official launch. We would like to thank them all for their vote of confidence as they are an important part of the upcoming platform.

Body: sure ! Scam 100% , i have not get paid for the bounty campaign maybe "8158 token holders" is their own.  here is what i received from their email --------------------  Hi everyone,  The tokens distribution for our bounty campaign has officially ended.  Everyone received their ATS tokens if there were no more than 3 registrations from the IP they registered with. We believe that multiple registrations from the same IP is a sign of fraudulent leads and suspended all such accounts.  There are 8158 token holders: https://etherscan.io/token/0x2dAEE1AA61D60A252DC80564499A69802853583A     We would like to apologize for the delay in sorting things out and take the time to address some of your concerns.  Our major issue with the bounty campaign was the fraudulent registrations.  Thousands of such registrations were entered into the system despite our best efforts to prevent this.  Steps we took during our bounty campaign to prevent such registrations:  -Enforced double opt-in on registrations  -Kept track of registration IP/confirmation IP, if they don’t match suspend the account.  -Kept track of the number of visitors each referral link accessed and disabled account where there were no visitors through the referral link but were showing an increasing number of referrals  -suspended accounts were the ETH address used by cheaters was the same, even if accounts had different IP addresses  -suspended account where name/email contained easily identifiable random data  -suspended account registration once a certain number of registrations happened from the same IP address  Despite our best efforts to filter through fake referrals, a high number of them still managed to get through and that was clear to us when the withdrawals form was completed. As a result, we’ve decided to suspend all accounts where there are more than 3 registrations from the same IP.  All payments to qualifying accounts have been completed.... ...

Author: 802529er
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Just got this email!!!!!   View online version   Hi everyone,  The tokens distribution for our bounty campaign has officially ended.  Everyone received their ATS tokens if there were no more than 3 registrations from the IP they registered with. We believe that multiple registrations from the same IP is a sign of fraudulent leads and suspended all such accounts.  There are 8158 token holders: https://etherscan.io/token/0x2dAEE1AA61D60A252DC80564499A69802853583A     We would like to apologize for the delay in sorting things out and take the time to address some of your concerns.  Our major issue with the bounty campaign was the fraudulent registrations.  Thousands of such registrations were entered into the system despite our best efforts to prevent this.  Steps we took during our bounty campaign to prevent such registrations:  -Enforced double opt-in on registrations  -Kept track of registration IP/confirmation IP, if they don’t match suspend the account.  -Kept track of the number of visitors each referral link accessed and disabled account where there were no visitors through the referral link but were showing an increasing number of referrals  -suspended accounts were the ETH address used by cheaters was the same, even if accounts had different IP addresses  -suspended account where name/email contained easily identifiable random data  -suspended account registration once a certain number of registrations happened from the same IP address  Despite our best efforts to filter through fake referrals, a high number of them still managed to get through and that was clear to us when the withdrawals form was completed. As a result, we’ve decided to suspend all accounts where there are more than 3 registrations from the same IP.  All payments to qualifying accounts have been completed.  If you did not receive any tokens, we apologize but your account was suspended and the decision is final. Please do not contact us about, such requests will remain unanswered. We checked the list 3 times to ensure we don’t miss anyone.  If you don’t know how to check if you received the ATS tokens or not, enter your ETH wallet address in etherscan.io and it will show you the tokens, if you received them (many of you used wallets that don’t show tokens by default).  Double and pending payments  Because of the increased amount of payments, some payments have been processed twice by the ETH network (don’t ask us why, theoretically this is supposed not to happen, yet it happened to some payments). To cover the number of tokens needed 1M tokens have been pulled from the authors reserved fund of 20M.  At the same time, some payments have been stuck in “processing” for hours and even days. We went on and checked the transactions log and resent all the failed payments.  User reviews  It has come to our attention that some users are upset about this situation and threatened with leaving bad reviews, calling us all sorts. We understand some people’s frustration and realize it’s nothing more we can do about. We did our best. We also received numerous extortion emails (from people who didn’t even participated in the bounty campaign) threatening to leave bad reviews if we don’t pay specific amounts of tokens. Needless to say, we ignored them all. Bad reviews are a natural thing and everyone is free to spend their time the way they feel appropriate.  Project develoment  Our project development continues regardless and a $4M marketing budget plus thousands of authors already waiting to join the upcoming platform are more than enough to ensure a successful launch and a bright future. This is where a project values stands in: the final product. We value the opinion of the 1% bounty participants, but at the end of the day pumping or dumping the ATS tokens (which we cannot control) has no impact on the successful development of the Authorship platform.  Exchange listing  We’d also like to announce our investors that this entire bounty situation has been discussed with several exchanges, and been told this is a general thing that happens with all ICOs bounties: you can never please everyone and cheaters are a nightmare to deal with messing things up. We are happy to have pleased 8158 token holders. Once things settle and everyone realizes that the distribution is over we’ll be submitting our listing requests as requested by several of you.  80% of the token holders are mostly authors and publishing industry members who look forward to our next year official launch. We would like to thank them all for their vote of confidence as they are an important part of the upcoming platform.  Free time  The Authorship team is going to take a week for free as it’s been a very busy past month. We’ll be returning Monday 25th with news about the exchange listings. Investors can reach us this week at investors@authorship.com for investment related questions.  Once again, we would like to thank everyone who put their trust in our project. We look forward to seeing the project one year from now!  Sincerely,  Authorship.com Team  This e-mail has been sent to 802529@protonmail.com, click here to unsubscribe.  11015 York Road, Cockeysville MD 21030 USA

We are happy to have pleased 8158 token holders. Once things settle and everyone realizes that the distribution is over we’ll be submitting our listing requests as requested by several of you.  80% of the token holders are mostly authors and publishing industry members who look forward to our next year official launch. We would like to thank them all for their vote of confidence as they are an important part of the upcoming platform.  Free time  The Authorship team is going to take a week for free as it’s been a very busy past month. We’ll be returning Monday 25th with news about the exchange listings. Investors can reach us this week at investors@authorship.com for investment related questions.  Once again, we would like to thank everyone who put their trust in our project. We look forward to seeing the project one year from now!  Sincerely,  Authorship.com Team

Author: 802529er
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Posting this here and encouraging other users to email the CEO with there complaints about how this bounty campaign has been run, at the end of the day ONE person seems to have been responsible for these mistakes.   “Dear Authorship CEO,  I write to you today to alert you to the current situation that has arisen from your bounty/marketing campaign. If you are not aware Authorship conducted a public bounty on popular platforms to garner support for your ICO.  The community responded in kind and quickly to provide marketing and raise awareness of the ICO.  Two days after the withdrawal form being releleased the Authorship campaign abruptly ended All distribution of bounty rewards.  This has caused unmeasurable damage to your brand and image, Please take the time to look at the attached bitcointalk thread and see the dissatisfaction of many participants and investors.  The community requests that this matter is urgently resolved and that Authorship honnor all bounty withdrawals unless they provided evidence that ones bounty’s weren’t earnt within the provided rules.  The response from the Authorship team or individuals responsiable for the bounty campaign has been sub-par, after the original email claiming all distribution has halted and wouldn’t continue, to then that all bounty’s above 1000 ATS will be rewarded, to the now “all users will be paid unless more then 3 signups from the same IP”  This has been within the space of 24-48 hours while the community has continued to attempt to find out if they have valid entry’s or have been disqualified.  As a Authorship bounty participante, Investor & author, I am deeply disappointed with the response so far and look forward to your response and resoultion.”

I'm investor and besides that I have reached 10 referrals, I'm still waiting for the 760 coins (incl fb and twitter) but I will wait patiently since I believe in this project and Peter should at least pay the investors their bounty coins as well.  There are just so many childish frustrated ##sholes here who are trying to make it look bad for the investors to have invested in this project but in the long term these crybaby's won't effect the path Authorship will take to be succesfull.  Even if I'm not getting the bounty ats coins, I will still support ATS.  There are worse things in life than some bounty coins you didn't get.  @hunnykaushal you were defending ATS properly and orderly and trying to help but it's a shame you had to send me a pm regarding some bounty shitty ico coins....

Author: MartinTheWanderer
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: That's the spirit.  I'll give it another 24hrs, but then I am ramping up the volume as well.  I have a simple rule (better than the '3 IP rule', lol), and I suggest many people live by that rule:  If a company cheats me or causes me a loss, I will negatively impact their business for at least 3x what they owe me.  It does not matter how big or small the amount was, fraud is fraud.  If a company like Wirex cheated me out of my Bitcoin Cash during the fork - I will not rest until their business has lost several customers and way more revenue than they took from me.  If Authorship withholds tokens from us for totally arbitrary reasons that were made up AFTER we joined the bounty program - well, make sure that for every person you referred they lose at least 3 potential authors/customers. For every token they owe you, post a friendly review, a glorious tweet, a totally unbiased steemit article...  'Keep the bastards honest' - or make them pick up the soap, if they don't like honest.  P.S.: and if it comes to that - I don't give a flying fuck if the handful of tokens I actually paid for goes to ZERO value as well.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Yes, there have been cases where double payments happened. It's not our fault, the transaction was sent just once, the ETH network processed it twice.  This doesn't mean someone is not going to receive their bounty because of this. We pulled funds to cover for this from the authors reserve fund, as everyone can see.  Please lets keep speculations away.  Also, since I've seen a couple more: "I use a yahoo email address, there is problem with yahoo emails". - Not true. "I use dash - in email address, there is a problem with dashes" - Not true "I am from Vietnam/Nigeria, they blocked these countries" - Not true.  Thank you

Body: Dear Sir @hunnykaushal  I promoted in steemit, facebook , personal emails and several posting in forums....and i have got every bit of track wherever i promoted....and i did my registration in my personal laptop only....so no question of even double registration.....and if you want i can give every bit of reference along with link wherever i promoted and i am quite sure i did like professional way of promotion... then after that i filled the form just with 15 mins of end of ICO and and that i saw the congratulation message and also received an email and i check my ETH wallet address as well, but till now i have not been paid...and adding further i have patiently watching all this since 14th and all the noise i could hear since yesterday and still not said a cingle word but at this moment i am really getting paranoid and in fact i am broke.....all my hard effort went in vain...i wrote a personal message to Mr Peter as well..... I dont want to hold anybody responsible....just want to say its the way of life to see various dimesions ...so lets move on.....its not our cup of tea...  Thanks

Author: MartinTheWanderer
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Actually it should be the other way round.  Experience from many years in affiliate marketing and MLM (and proven again by forum posts here and elsewhere):  Honest people and 'regular people' tend to get very few sign-ups. They are also not 'sellers', but 'buyers' - what this project needs in the long run.  The spammers and cheaters get many.  Of course there are good promoters who are legit, but the percentage of cheaters is actually HIGHER among those who earned (or not) a high amount of bounty tokens.

Author: DrOctogon
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: There is not 1 IP address for each device connected to the internet, limiting by IP address in this manner is likely to have many false positives, it's a poor metric for this purpose.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hi, Things are good, there is no problem.  We've updated 2 exchanges already and explained the situation and been told there is no problem, that bounty campaigns are always somewhat of mess for all ICOs. As long as we distributed the tokens to all investors there is nothing to worry about.  There will be a calm down period of about 1 week than we'll hear the exact date when we'll be listed.  There is also a second smaller exchange that contacted us and mentioned we are free to list the moment we want, just have to pay their listing fee and will be up in 5 days from that moment.  We'll wait one week for everything to calm down and submit our applications; as soon we do this we'll update on our blog.  PS: investor questions please email investors@authorship.com , our contact address is filled with where/why/how bounty questions.  Thank you

Author: MartinTheWanderer
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: 1. I should definitely not be affected by the '3 IP rule' (one friend of mine, 2 random sign-ups from blog or twitter) but have not been paid out so far as well.  2. As stated earlier, that rule will affect many people who did nothing wrong. Many people esp. in developing countries are behind forced proxies and appear to be having the same IP if their provider uses this way to save bandwidth and IP allocation - and they usually don't know about it. Many people use VPN like the built-in Opera VPN for privacy concerns (e.g. my girlfriend will not get her 75 tokens, she routinely uses Opera VPN since our local ISP is, ummm, a bit nosey...) and are still perfectly legit, real persons... There were very few rules on the bounty website, now they narrowed down who they pay out. Bad business practice. And rules that actually favor the professional cheaters, who are now boasting on other forums and often got paid even twice, LOL...

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Thank you for the advice. It is fully noted.  In the future we'll probably use private funding as we initially intended for this project. This is how we always worked before, with private funding. This was our first meeting with ICOs and the community here, so you can say it was a trial and error and we used to rely on a lot of advice we received here. Not trying to find excuses, just pointing that there are always 2 sides of a story. I realize our mistakes and once again I apologize for this.  Our project development continues as this was our reason of raising funds. I'm positive that this entire situation will be long forgotten once everyone sees us and running and with thousands of authors selling the books through our platform.  Thank you

Author: MartinTheWanderer
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Trying to keep the criticism constructive.  So, dear Authorship, for your next ICO (you will need it after this disaster) a few hints, if you want to run a bounty program:  use a professional referral/affiliate software or 3rd party provider. People have been weeding out fake sign-ups for over a decade. They know how to do it. You obviously did not. Make up your mind. Do not keep changing the rules. Pisses people off, and rightfully so. If you want to discriminate against whole countries, VPN users, the TOR community, etc. -  say so, upfront. Be aware that you would kick Kim Dotcom, Julian Assange, Ed Snowden and probably every digital nomad living in Bali (or Paraguay, like me) as well. Dumb. If you want to work for the world, learn how the world works... E.g. there are whole countries where 90% of users are behind forced proxies. As I wrote in my earlier endorsement for this ICO: the biggest challenge will be to make blockchain usable and painless for people outside the blockchain nerd community. We do not need another nerd circle jerk. You allegedly wanted readers and authors from the real world. But now you scold, blame and insult every 'normal' person who just thought 10 bucks for an email address would be interesting. How many potential users and publishers were among them?  I still think that the basic idea behind Authorship.com is great. Re-gaining trust and countering all the bad press all over the web will be hard. If there was/is an honest project behind this ICO, I wish you luck to fix the mess...

Author: Noizie
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Oh well, seems we are playin IP-Lottery now.. If one used thor or a vpn service: Screwed. Ip pool is very limited, so the chance of 3+ registrations with the same IP is very possible. If your Internet provider does give you a new ip after reconnect (dsl/mobile) same thing. IP pool limited, next connect, someone else has the IP you had before. You use things (in germany) like "freifunk" you are out of the game, limited IP pool. Working in a company and sharing the IP with your co-workers.. very bad thing. Using a Hot-spot : Bye bye.  I picked up, that there are 650.000 tokens left AFTER cleaning out the so called cheaters. Are you really telling me, that 65% of the accounts are fake accounts?? C'mon, that just can't be true! Again: Hooking the account to a IP is the most stupid thing to do! You CAN NOT identify a person by IP address! That's not how the internet is working! This "3+ from the same IP" rule is just BS. There are so many other ways to handle this, like cookies, flash cookies and some other things (experts know, won't mention his now) But just filtering by IP address is a thing for novices, you'll end up with exactly that, what's going on now: Shitstorm.  To make a statement here: Me and 6 colleagues did promotion for Authorship. We sent mailings (with pictured instructions for the crypto newbies)  how to participate, how to set up a Wallet, how to register and so on.  All together we, 7 people, should have around 400-420 referrals. Yesterday we asked our refs in another mail if they received any Tokens yet. Most stated: Account suspended (at the time the withdraw form was up) or for now, NOTHING received yet. So what's going on? German IP's all got banned? Telekom, Vodafon, O2? There's only 1 (ONE!) account from the 400+ (until now) that has been payed out.  Again, the 3 Ip rule is major BS, you also could do a "first letter of email is a V" rule. I just feel sorry for the time we spent in supporting our list members, I know many of them also invested in the ICO (for that i have to say that the tokens arrived for everyone!)  Hint: Next time make the rules clear and precise before you start doing a campaign like this. Changing rules afterwards, when things have ended, is the much worst thing to do.

Author: Trofo
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Oh man, I was a little busy last week and didn't check autorship ann so often. Imagine my surprise in seeing some 70 pages of new posts. Nothing gets people writing like troubles with receiving payment/tokens.  I was really admiring how you handled all the fud posts before Peter. But I must confess that recent tidings have me  a little worried. You can imagine my surprise after receiving autorship Emails that bounty payments are forfeited after only few days of taking care of them. We should have had 45 days to collect if I remember correctly. I see autorship has in the meantime decided to make some reparations but i admit i have not had the time to read trough all that pages of fud. It would be helpful if there was some summary at the op.  Anyway, I will wait patiently for some more time to see how this will evolve. But if every single honest person who earned 75 tokens doesn't receive them in 45 days from ICO, end it damages autorship credibility in my eyes and I don't intend do be part of such project. I didn't have many referrals but almost all of them are my good friends and I'll pay them all from my pocket if necessary since this was their first venture in crypto world and I don't want it to end with disappointment. Situations like this make it hard for regular persons to embrace crypto instead of fiat.

Author: georgef7
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hello,  Your withdrawal request was received and will be processed within 2-3 days to the ETH address you provided:  0x128a4212b5b1625442FDD5e6228eecC29051EB85  Thank you,  Authorship.com Team   You know I am just a simple nobody from the Philippines.  I worked hard for this campaign bounty and did everything on the up and up.  My reason was to support my family and I was never given the ats token as promised.  I sent messages on fb and through my email.  I will say this as I don't know much.  My family needs all the help we can get but I won't ask for handouts.  I can do the work but when a company or a coin does not keep their word and blames people for filling out the form more than 3 times or worse things then why would anyone buy this token or coin.  A campaign's word should be bond.  I worked and gave my part but you failed me and probably others and made excuses.  I want this seen by others so they will know at the beginning if some of us small people will be treated in this fashion how can you expect to be successful.  You will get your karma but I will pray for your success any way.  since other avenues have not worked if you still want to do the right thing here it is easy.  Here is my info I really hope you will take the time to do the right thing and not push me off to send a message to Peter or someone else that won't send the tokens as promised.  Even if you won't give me the whole bounty anything would be kindly accepted and I will f/u with a post that you did the right thing here.    Thank you from the Philippines....George  email:  telemarketingbyedwin at g mail.com myetherwallet address: 0x128a4212b5b1625442fdd5e6228eecc29051eb85

Author: TheCryproMaster
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: OK Authorship.com , specifically for you Authorship.com CEO: Nolan Warfield  Hope you had a good nights rest. You've got to sort this out ASAP. An official statement on your website is a minimum requirement on what you're doing next. Its counter productive having tired staff posting increasingly irritating comments on this thread.  Offering 3 book tokens as a solution to a lot of hard working legitimate bounty hunters is just an insult. Half the idiots on this thread can't read anyway. And after this pr disaster you'll be lucky if you get 3 books listed on your site.  You Mr Warfield have time to fix this, but do it professionally and do it in a timely manner. Don't let this product fail on a stupid knee jerk reaction to a few fools cheating the system.  At a minimum you must  1. Give the tokens to all legit bounty hunters - no token limit everyone 75 ATS and up. This is why we all did this.  2. Fix the email with var=o, its stupid even now it still shows this it confuses the idiots who don't read this thread and causes extra work for you.  3. Have a way to verify the eth address is correct at the withdraw page. Have a link to etherscan its simple to do.  4. At the least reassure everyone you have a process in place to ensure everyone gets their tokens, no matter how long it takes.  Get you ICO back on track. Fix this mess. Give your staff and backers reassurance you can handle a difficult situation.

Author: MartinTheWanderer
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Ah, another Exodus user... xD  Exodus does not support/show all kind of tokens, does not mean they are not there.  Try to import the ether address that you used in Exodus in some other wallet that supports more tokens (e.g. IMToken, MyEtherWallet, etc.)  If you just want to check if the tokens have been paid, you can search for your ether address in the ATS transfer list: https://etherscan.io/token/0x2dAEE1AA61D60A252DC80564499A69802853583A?  If the ATS tokens have been transferred to your address, all is good, you can take your time to find a wallet that lets you access them.

Author: IDabOnThemHATERS
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Honestly here's how the distribution SHOULD have went down: 1) They make sure each account is legitimate and didn't break any of their rules, anyone who broke any rules is automatically suspended. 2) For the legit users, they check all submitted "ERC-20" addresses to see if they're valid, if they're not, those users get an email telling them to submit the withdrawal form in order to correct their address. 3) They send the legit users with valid Ethereum addresses their tokens first. 4) They send the people who submitted their corrected addresses through the withdrawal form second. If the address is still invalid, then it won't be sent and their account will be suspended. 5) Any addresses that were not valid and that were not resubmitted with a valid address after 45 days as well as any cheaters, those tokens get distributed randomly to investors.

Author: MartinTheWanderer
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: I totally understand and share your sentiment.  Yet:  people are cunts. It is known. If you allegedly want to build a platform of that size, you'd know that as well. If your affiliate program can not filter out the scam artists, you just have to swallow it, not give everybody the finger, errrr, three free books...  it did not cost them anything. They created Ether tokens, it is not like they are handing out gold coins that they had to pay for previously... And they collected a handsome sum of Ether. People promoted this ICO like crazy (even some of the cheaters), so Authorship raised a lot more money than without that bounty program, AND they now have a huge list of emails, names and ether addresses they can use/sell even IF they were convinced the majority of referral signups was fraudulent... even IF the technical difficulties were as they stated in their email earlier... it would have been wiser to be silent. Now people think Authorship tried to wiggle out, AND that they are significantly less competent than we thought before...

Author: snodo
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: That's not true - not all were excluded. 20% were paid 80% showed suspicious activity - those 80% should not be paid.  Some of these 80% entered BTC instead of ETH address.. or non ERC20-compatible wallets -> no chance to pay them anyway  But the most of them had many referals from the same IP -> looks like an attempt to cheat the system. It turned out that really many of those did NOT cheat but had sent the ref link to family or cowokers or they signed up for some friends (on the same computer) or something like that. So the ATS team decided to allow the same IP up to 3 times which still might lead to legit guys being excluded, but which also leads to cheaters being accepted - so it's a compromise.

Author: kursattekin
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: I filled form a few seconds after ico finished but it is not first come,first serve. I got confirmation for my payment, i only register one time, i share on webboard, i warned users never register more than one, i showed them how to create ethereum on mew, after ico finish, i warned my ref to fill form, they all different ip, different ethereum wallet, different location, different computer, all traffic from webboard, my webboard link has more than 1700 views, i contact with Peter for payment he said all ok, can get payment, what result now? 3 free books? Not get any payment ( 3000 ATS ) i bought from ico more than 2ETH, all was good, Peter support and replies but they not respect my efford, because of many scammers, because of double payment i get nothing. I believe some users same as me, and i believe some scammers already got payment.   Users who didn’t receive their free ATS yet, I am sorry to inform you that all distributions have been suspended.       View online version    Hi, We would like to update everyone regarding the Bounty Campaign status.   As you are probably already aware, since yesterday we have started to process bounty campaign withdrawals. This gave birth to a cascade of disappointed messages (thousands of them) from users who noticed their accounts got suspended. We apologize for not being able to get back to everyone, it’s just not humanly possible given the volume of messages we received.   We would like to clarify why an account get suspended in the first place: the #1 reason is that from the same IP as yours there’s been over 20+ other registrations. This is in 99% of the cases a clear sign of fraudulent registrations (people create multiple accounts to earn more ATS tokens).   In the remaining 1% of the cases, everyone claims a fair usage (their entire 100+ work colleagues registered too, they live in a campus and everyone else shares the same IP, 200+ friends came by his home, etc.).   While these, could in theory be valid reasons, it turns out most of the time it’s just an excuse, as such as a rule any such duplicate registrations have been suspended.    The second reason why people get suspended is for fraudulent referrals. They use services like TOR or VPN to change their IP and create multiple accounts (usually hundreds of them). These are easily to spot as most of the time the names and emails are random numbers/fake names/emails. Turns out many people claim to be using TOR or VPN for genuine reasons, thus they shouldn’t be suspended either. If that is correct or not, it’s something one can’t really affirm with 100% certainty.   People tried to cheat the referral system through other methods as well, but we won’t get into more details; you got the overall idea.   We tried our best, did all that was humanly possible to discern between the genuine and fraudulent registrations considering that about 90% of the people who registered to our bounty campaign still doesn’t know what Ether is, not even today. We realize everyone jumps of joy when they hear about $10 free, but we’d have personally hoped for a different kind of results.   Having the final filtered list of users which we can make the payment to, our tech team prepared an automated way of processing the payments. Since there have been close to 10,000 participants to be offered ATS tokens, a manual processing payment was not humanly possible.   And here another set of problems started:   Around 15% of the users emailed us after submitting the form that they sent us a wrong address, that they want to change it, for various reasons. As clearly indicated, that it impossible as once a payment was introduced into the automated processing system, nothing can be changed about it.   Around 20% of the users who requested a withdrawal entered an invalid address (they either entered their BTC address, their ETC instead of ETH address, or some non-valid address).   Around 40% of the users who requested a withdrawal used a non ERC-20 compatible address despite our best efforts of explaining this and forcing everyone to mark a checkbox confirming this.   Because of all of these, it turns out we ended up to choke the ETH network with transaction and errors to the point where the few peers that were still accepting our transactions for distribution through the network rejected all connections.  We hardly managed to make the investors payments as a result, manually, one by one, as the automated way was out of the question now. There are still around 60 investors out of the 1900 total whose payments are still being stuck, somewhere in “processing”. If you are one of the unlucky few, please contact us a.s.a.p. and we’ll make sure to retry the payment until it gets through.   We ended up with only 20% of all the withdrawal requests processed, the rest were rejected for various reasons and all retry attempts failed. Some transactions been stuck jumping from peer to peer for almost 24 hours before failing.   Given the current circumstances where we are making payments to wrong/not valid addresses, makes little sense to continue this never-ending struggle. This forced us to take the following decision:   Users who already received their ATS tokens, congrats: your transaction went through successfully, you can use your ATS tokens.   Users who didn’t receive their free ATS yet, I am sorry to inform you that all distributions have been suspended.  Considering that most of the users only earned 75 ATS, it’s been decided that a fair compensation will be granted to everyone who participated in our bounty campaign in exchange.   ALL USERS, including the initially suspended ones, will receive, as a sign of our appreciation for your interest in our upcoming project a COUPON valid for the purchase of 3 BOOKS for FREE. You will not have to pay anything. The 3 books cost can be, in total, up to $100.   Once the Authoship platform is up and running, you can use the coupon to order 3 books, of your choice, absolutely for free. This, for most of the people who participated on our bounty campaign has a bigger value than the 75 ATS they received.   Your coupon code is : XXXXXXXXX   You can use this coupon as soon our platform is available to receive 3 books for free. Please remember your email address (the one you received this email to, as the coupon is connected to your email address).  You don't need to complete any form, the coupon was already applied to this email address.   We apologize for the entire situation and thank you for your support. You’ve all been incredible.   Help us make this promising idea of a book friendly future a reality!   PS: the remaining ~650,000 ATS tokens left from the distribution will be offered, through lottery to 25 investors who contributed to our token sale by ETH. The 25 random winners will be picked Wednesday 20th and announced on our blog.   Sincerely, Authorship.com Team

Author: MartinTheWanderer
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: If we get our bounty tokens or not (nothing so far)...  in any case today was a MASSIVE PR disaster.  Authorship team knows - and has deleted that embarrassing rant that was posted earlier today on  their website (and sent to their users via email). Damage is done, though. The text has been screenshotted and quoted all over the web.  And even now, several hours later: no clear statement, no official update on the website, no retraction on the fishy claims that were made in that announcement that was supposed to cheat the vast majority of bounty promoters out of their tokens in exchange for some - very hypothetical - books.  Just some panicked backpedaling since the backlash was louder and more determined than expected.  Authorship - you better do something about your credibility.  People including myself invested money in your platform.  What you have shown today in terms of communication skills, disaster management and (non-existent) contingency plans, etc.  - does not make you look like a professional company that will be able to make a platform with many thousands of authors and even MORE transactions and fraud attempts work and profitable.  Investors - even those just speculating on a quick profit on the tokens, not long-term revenue - will not be amused.

Author: MartinTheWanderer
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: victim blaming and a very confused mindset.  Nothing is free here.  You had to submit your email and personal data incl. name and ether wallet address.  If you wanted referrals, you had to promote (=do marketing for Authorship, cost per hour usually much higher than 10 bucks...)  So - people bashing Authorship that they tried to get away with dumping the bounty program completely, or the half-assed retraction now, are perfectly right.  If you run an affiliate scheme and can't handle it and then try to wiggle out, not your users' fault.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: We tried to explain this is happening, everyone called us scammer and didn't believe us. The transaction was sent just ONCE. This is what happens when mass transactions are being sent, nothing we can do about. We'll pay everyone who qualifies to make everyone happy (about 90% of the payments were already sent). Not sure how sending more tokens to cheaters will help the value of the tokens for honest promoters, since they will only do one thing: dump them, but, we do what you want us to do. Hopefully by tomorrow all the payments will be processed and we can close this chapter.  Regards, Peter

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: As I mentioned, this is how the ETH network behaves when one sends large amounts of payments at once. Some transactions will jump from peer to peer, will show on etherscan as "transaction not found" since it wasn't propagated through the entire network, even for a day, then pop all of a sudden out of nowhere. Meanwhile, we know we made that payment, yet it's showing nowhere. So what do we do when people say they didn't received it? We have nothing else to do but resend the payment, just to see that the next day the lost transaction suddenly appears.

Author: MartinTheWanderer
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Well, everybody still 'defending' Authorship: did you read that novel they sent out today and posted it on their site as well?  If you have not received your 'free' tokens by now, you are out of luck and may eventually read 3 books for free, if and when they actually build their platform.  They payed out their 'investors', but the whole bounty joke was about free marketing, and grabbing a TON of email addresses and related personal information (name, ether wallet, etc.) Data brokers. Expect a lot of ICO spam and coin-related phishing on the email you used to sign up - I am already experiencing this.   BTW - even IF what they claim in their newsletter is true, they are not capable of running a platform with > 100K authors as they claim. If you run an affiliate program and push it aggressively, but can't handle cheaters or the technology: fail. Or criminal intent.  Also: dear Authorship, posting that 'coupon code' publicly on the Internet is an additional middle finger for everyone who promoted your little scam. As in: 'hey, you get NOTHING, every dolt on the planet gets the same promotional nothingburger.'  Sad, since the concept of Authorship.com made sense. But not like this.  P.S.: where did you get that alleged 'latest Peter update'? No statements on their site or Twitter. Last official statement is the nonsense rant they sent out earlier.

Author: beket
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hello everyone!  To People: Pls, don't panic and don't use angry words just wait a little - Pete said he and his team trying their best to complete all legitimate payments to people who didn't cheat while their referral activity. Understand that it is partly your fault that this is happening right now - due to your lack of knowledge in the blockchain tech and ethereum platform. I am sure that noone would be cheated by authorship team and sooner or later everybody will get thier tokens even a start 75 ATS. What is happening now is just a technical issue. Don't spam here and cry lets talk politely 'cos we are all adults and not a babies! Right now the tokens are USELESS as they still not listed on any Exchange and this process will take up to 2 weeks so just calm down and let Pete and his team do their job. We are all here to support their work since we are interested in success of this project so just do it!  To Peter: I understand people if they get more suspicious and worry for their investment if someone will intentionally or not spell his/her name not in a right manner as we are here not just friendly tea-chatting here but involved into worldwide perpective project and that's why I assume it would be more pro to give correct personal data and background of each member of your team. Also I urge you to treat fair and not to forget anybody who honestly promoted your future platform. Even if it takes some time. I am sure they will wait any time you need to technically proceed with the payment. And  in tx due to wrong data is not thier fault nor yours. It is just what had happen and with this fact I assume your team must be honest till the end and hold your promise!  As for me I myself had received my tokens right the next day ICO campaign ended and of course I am thankful for this.  People just be more tolerant and everything will end good and fair to everyone!

Author: Fluffy Bunny
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: I've been watching to this Token for a while now, Been referring people from Forum (Won't name the forum to avoid Advertising). I'm not complaining why i haven't received my ATS Tokens or what so ever. But in my personal opinion it's just a dumb thingy to reward people whoever earned more than 1000 ATS Tokens. In the beginning, when the bounty campaign was up you and your "Crew" stated that everyone would receive their 75 ATS by signing up. Now you claim that only people who earned more than 1000 ATS Tokens can receive their tokens.. That's just unfair right? I'm not saying that your punishment against Cheaters is bad, no peter.. i'm pretty sure 90% of loyal campaigners appreciate that kind of decision, But what about us? Who worked smoothly? Me, myself earned somewhere close to 1000 ATS Tokens and i'm pretty sure most of the campaigners earned below 1000 ATS Tokens somewhere like 60-70% of us. So by stating your new decision means that these 60-70% of campaigners are automatically excluded from the campaign just because they're below 1000 ATS Tokens? Come on Peter.. just think more logical, you're going in a wrong way and in my opinion this won't give you further trust.. Just stating my opinion, the rest is on you.. But my personal advice is to reward those people whoever earned below than 1000 ATS Tokens Smoothly. (WITHOUT Cheating. i'm stating once again that excluding cheaters from the campaign is a good decision, but excluding people who have lower than 1000 ATS Tokens is a bad decision) The rest is up to you.. Still Good luck!

Author: Benezim
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: I have invested into this ICO and signed up with my email address. I have not referred this to anyone else and could not care less whether I receive the 75 ATS or not. And still I have a few comments / suggestions.  1.   I did not invest into this ICO because of the business model or cutting edge tech. I saw something that I rarely see in crypto - the developers were actively engaging with the community and building trust. As I believe that emotions and psychology play a major role in crypto, this factor convinced me to put my money in. All this trust can #poof# disappear instantly if wrong decisions are made. Right now, I feel not very optimistic about my investment 2.   I was celebrating when you started unmasking the scammers (x sign ups from same IP, y referrals into the same ETH wallet) and was impressed that you guys knew your stuff. But then you suddenly stopped working through it. I think no one here can really understand the complex task you are facing right now, but I still think there is a way:  A)   Stick to your banning principles. There may be single innocent folks that are hit by the ban hammer, but overall the rules are fine B)   Work through the bounty withdrawals. It may take weeks or even months and be painful, but you gotta stick to your rules. If users mess up their ETH addresses, bad luck for them (you may think about a FAQ for first time crypto users or consider the ERC20 compatibility query that has been posted here before). C)   Don’t exclude folks (e.g. less than 1000 ATS), don’t reduce the 45 days - you gotta stick to your rules  Just look at all the anger here

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: You didn't understood why we can't to this. When we start sending payments and we get to send payments to "fail addresses" after a couple fails we can't send anything else for a couple more hours as the peer nodes will reject all the remaining transactions.  Let's say I pay you now and then I hit 10 fail addresses, I get stuck for a couple more hours, meaning we'll never get to send payments to everyone. If we try to send more, all those attempts will fail as well.  We will be paying people who earned a minimum of 1,000 to begin with. Once that is successful, we can see if there is anything else we can do to improve the situation.

Author: Midgarosormr
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Early on in the bounty, I was in the top ten on the leader-board.  I promoted your project in good faith on Reddit, even corresponding with you via e-mail to confirm that promoting/inviting via the platform was acceptable (not "spam"). I guided people on there, helping them and giving them instructions on how to set up a MyEtherWallet to receive their tokens.  And now you pull this: not only will I not receive my tokens for promoting your platform, but none of the people who trusted me on Reddit will receive theirs, as well.  They put their faith in me, as I put my faith in your platform, and you've just, to be crude, shat over both like some greasy cars salesman.  You're collectively punishing the genuine users because of the fraudsters, offering a token (to use a pun), a worthless token, of a few measly books instead of what was promised to people.  You basically scammed or duped people into being advertisement platforms for the false promise of compensation.  If you're going to do an airdrop, at least have the decency to find a way to fulfil your promise.  No, you didn't have to do an airdrop in the first place, but you did: you committed yourself to it, and now you're essentially weaselling your way out of it.  I am utterly disgusted by this.  Fix it. Give people what you promised somehow, or the reputation of your platform is going to tank it before it even launches.  Hell, this stunt may have tainted it irreparably already.

Body: UPDATE:  I understand many of you are upset, and I can understand your situation.  We will be manually paying each member who earned a minimum of 1,000 tokens.  Please be patient as manually paying every one is the only way to ensure you will receive the ATS tokens.  Once again, I apologize for the situation and this is what we can do to try to remedy part of this situation.  Thank you, Peter

Author: sandler425
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: What concern is it to you that some of your people don't understand how to use their free ATS or what ETH is?  I would think that would actually be good for ATS because there would be slightly less in circulation.  Not following through on your promises, however, will slash the reputation of your company and severely hurt the value of ATS.  While you may not believe this, that is currently the state of crypto markets, which are extremely responsive to news like this.  ATS will not do nearly as well as it may have as a result of this.    It would be far better for you all to take your time over the next 40 days simply distributing out the tokens, regardless of whether people know what to do with them.  Whether or not they are familiar with ETH has no real bearing on your company, but your company's reputation IS at stake here.

Author: DrOctogon
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors

Author: sandler425
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: You ask what money you got from the free ATS?  In theory, you've received money from investors who would otherwise not have known about the campaign if not for those of us working for your "free" ATS.  Your claims that you feel it didn't work out and that you now regret your bounty campaign are unacceptable this late into the process.  You may have made a poor business decision but at this point it's far more important that you simply follow through with it.  Also, those who receive ATS tokens will have less value because people will not be buying ATS as much when they are aware of the way you are retracting your company's promises like this.  You are not doing any favors to your investors.  You are in fact lowering the value of the coin by slashing the reputation of your company.    Do you see that this action really has no upside?  Doing so will lower the value of ATS to investors after ICO. It would be a far, far better decision for you to retract your previous update and continue to the best of your abilities in distrubting the ATS tokens as planned, for the next 40 days or however much time was left.

Author: Noizie
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: That's just ridiculous. Me and friends together should have around 400+ referrals. I, and so many others, INVESTED in your ICO by buying ATS also. 90% of our referrals seem to be SUSPENDED due to your filter whatsoever. I (I own a IT company which also does media campaigns) would never treat my customers like that. I say customers, because many of the bounty hunters WILL BE your FUTURE customers. You rely on them to make Authorship work. You spend so much time, and energy to hunt those scammers. And like i mentioned before, your collateral damage goes in the very wrong direction. Now you come up with "sorry folks, no ats, have a book!" Why don't you just pay out the ATS to everyone, scammer or not, and concentrate on Authorships future. Like you already mentioned, 1 mio ATS is just 1 % of the whole thing, no harm done. If there weren't so many scammers as you claim there are you would have paid 1 mio ATS anyway, so whats the big problem with this i ask.

Author: sandler425
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Stop making judgments about your supportive community at large based on the fools in Bitcointalk threads who don't know what ETH is! There's enough of us fully aware that you should release your tokens as you promised.  Those who didn't use an ERC-20 compatible address are responsible for themselves, just as in any ICO.  What you're dealing with is completely normal for every ICO.  You promised a bounty campaign with $10 results and it's completely unfair to those of us who participated in it.  We are not asking you to change any rules.  We are asking you to stick to the original rules, which were laid out clearly from day 1, including the rule of banning all accounts which were processed from the same IP address, and give out hte coins as you promised.  After all the work we go through for your campaign, this is a completely unacceptable result.  At the very least, you should buy back the "coupon" you've given us for $10 or something then.  Just stick with the plan you've had for distributing coins for months.  Stop changing things at the last minute.  Retract your statements.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: UPDATE: Authorship Bounty Campaign  Hi, We would like to update everyone regarding the Bounty Campaign status.  As you are probably already aware, since yesterday we have started to process bounty campaign withdrawals. This gave birth to a cascade of disappointed messages (thousands of them) from users who noticed their accounts got suspended. We apologize for not being able to get back to everyone, it’s just not humanly possible given the volume of messages we received.  We would like to clarify why an account get suspended in the first place: the #1 reason is that from the same IP as yours there’s been over 20+ other registrations. This is in 99% of the cases a clear sign of fraudulent registrations (people create multiple accounts to earn more ATS tokens).  In the remaining 1% of the cases, everyone claims a fair usage (their entire 100+ work colleagues registered too, they live in a campus and everyone else shares the same IP, 200+ friends came by his home, etc.). While these, could in theory be valid reasons, it turns out most of the time it’s just an excuse, as such as a rule any such duplicate registrations have been suspended.  The second reason why people get suspended is for fraudulent referrals. They use services like TOR or VPN to change their IP and create multiple accounts (usually hundreds of them). These are easily to spot as most of the time the names and emails are random numbers/fake names/emails. Turns out many people claim to be using TOR or VPN for genuine reasons, thus they shouldn’t be suspended either. If that is correct or not, it’s something one can’t really affirm with 100% certainty.  People tried to cheat the referral system through other methods as well, but we won’t get into more details; you got the overall idea.  We tried our best, did all that was humanly possible to discern between the genuine and fraudulent registrations considering that about 90% of the people who registered to our bounty campaign still doesn’t know what Ether is, not even today. We realize everyone jumps of joy when they hear about $10 free, but we’d have personally hoped for a different kind of results.  Having the final filtered list of users which we can make the payment to, our tech team prepared an automated way of processing the payments. Since there have been close to 10,000 participants to be offered ATS tokens, a manual processing payment was not humanly possible.  And here another set of problems started:  Around 15% of the users emailed us after submitting the form that they sent us a wrong address, that they want to change it, for various reasons. As clearly indicated, that it impossible as once a payment was introduced into the automated processing system, nothing can be changed about it.  Around 20% of the users who requested a withdrawal entered an invalid address (they either entered their BTC address, their ETC instead of ETH address, or some non-valid address).  Around 40% of the users who requested a withdrawal used a non ERC-20 compatible address despite our best efforts of explaining this and forcing everyone to mark a checkbox confirming this.  Because of all of these, it turns out we ended up to choke the ETH network with transaction and errors to the point where the few peers that were still accepting our transactions for distribution through the network rejected all connections.  We hardly managed to make the investors payments as a result, manually, one by one, as the automated way was out of the question now. There are still around 60 investors out of the 1900 total whose payments are still being stuck, somewhere in “processing”. If you are one of the unlucky few, please contact us a.s.a.p. and we’ll make sure to retry the payment until it gets through.  We ended up with only 20% of all the withdrawal requests processed, the rest were rejected for various reasons and all retry attempts failed. Some transactions been stuck jumping from peer to peer for almost 24 hours before failing.  Given the current circumstances where we are making payments to wrong/not valid addresses, makes little sense to continue this never-ending struggle. This forced us to take the following decision:  Users who already received their ATS tokens, congrats: your transaction went through successfully, you can use your ATS tokens.  Users who didn’t receive their free ATS yet, I am sorry to inform you that all distributions have been suspended.  Considering that most of the users only earned 75 ATS, it’s been decided that a fair compensation will be granted to everyone who participated in our bounty campaign in exchange.  ALL USERS, including the initially suspended ones, will receive, as a sign of our appreciation for your interest in our upcoming project a COUPON valid for the purchase of 3 BOOKS for FREE. You will not have to pay anything. The 3 books cost can be, in total, up to $100.  Once the Authoship platform is up and running, you can use the coupon to order 3 books, of your choice, absolutely for free. This, for most of the people who participated on our bounty campaign has a bigger value than the 75 ATS they received.  Your coupon code is : BOUNTY3FREE  You can use this coupon as soon our platform is available to receive 3 books for free. Please remember your email address (the one you registered with, as the coupon is connected to your email address).  You don’t need to complete any form, the coupon was already applied to the email addresses on file.  We apologize for the entire situation and thank you for your support. You’ve all been incredible.  Help us make this promising idea of a book friendly future a reality!  PS: the remaining ~650,000 ATS tokens left from the distribution will be offered, through lottery to 25 investors who contributed to our token sale by ETH. The 25 random winners will be picked Wednesday 20th and announced on our blog.  Sincerely, Authorship.com Team  http://authorship.com/2017/09/16/update-authorship-bounty-campaign/

Author: Darkoth89
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: My bad. Looks like it does!  Coinomi now natively supports 200 tokens.  Please consult this article for more information and screenshots: https://coinomi.freshdesk.com/support/solutions/articles/29000013330-how-do-i-add-a-supported-eth-token-in-coinomi-  If the token you're holding is not in our list of 200 natively supported tokens, you can still always add it manually. Here's how. Go to https://etherscan.io/tokens Find and click on the token you wish to add from the list. From your ETH wallet main page, swipe twice to the left to get to dApps page. Click the "+" icon on the top right of the screen. On the "Add Contract" page, enter the following: Name: The name of the token. Description: Any description you would like or leave blank Website: From the token's etherscan.io page, copy the "Official Site" url Contract Address: From the token's etherscan.io page, copy the "Contract Address". Contract-Suit: Select token-template for ERC20 contracts. Contract-ABI: From the token's etherscan.io page, click on the Contract Address. In the address page, click on the Contract Source tab, and scroll down to the ABI text. Copy paste the entire text to the Contract-ABI line of Coinomi. Another way to easily fetch an ABI is to use etherscans api like this example, replacing the ETH address in the link with the official contract address of your token, as seen on the token's etherscan.io page. Please contact us if you require help with this step. Click on "ADD CONTRACT" on the bottom of your device's page.  Please note that the numbers in the token-template are currently unscaled. The non-supported tokens do not get a coin-like interface and wallet.   Source: https://coinomi.freshdesk.com/support/solutions/articles/29000009779-how-can-i-add-a-token-that-is-not-in-your-list-of-200-natively-supported-tokens-

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: RELAX. You left 10 messages already about this. We are all humans and we all sleep. Yes, we have a semi-automated process for making the payments, but everything needs to be supervised as transactions do also fail when the ETH network is busy (earlier there were 10,000 pending transations globally on the network), so we also need to pause things at times. Everyone who received a successful message after filling the form will receive the tokens, please be patient; there is nothing you can do with the tokens anyway until we get listed through exchanges which will take 1-2 more weeks.

Author: MyTimeCoin
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hi all, sorry if this question was already asked. What I'm interested in is the following: there are a lot of authors who want to publish low-quality content. They might even be convinced that their book is a masterpiece, but honestly, in most cases, it is not. So how would you deal with such pieces? And who would edit the books uploaded? I mean, when you are writing a book, the initial text is getting through thousands of edits. You require a professional editor from the publisher or from a private company, or whatsoever. So how do you automize these processes with the help of blockchain?

Author: Darkoth89
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Quote from: Darkoth89 on September 15, 2017, 08:46:26 AM For those of you who can't read, here's an FAQ of the spammed questions.  How much are ATS tokens worth? The recommended price is $0.15  When will I get my tokens? Investors are expected to get theirs in 24 hours, bounty could be 2-3 days.  When will ATS be on an exchange? Once the tokens have been distributed to everyone, then there might be a couple of days wait.  It depends on the exchanges themselves.  How do I claim my bounty? http://authorship.com/withdraw/  How do I see my tokens in a ERC-20 wallet like MyEtherWallet? Click on 'Add Custom token' and fill out the following information  The ATS token contract address is : “0x2dAEE1AA61D60A252DC80564499A69802853583A” Token Symbol: ATS Token Name: Authorship Token Token decimals: 4  My brothers uncles dads mum referred themselves 500 times using my IP and ETH wallet, where are my tokens? You are banned, nice try.  Multiple accounts with the same IP / ETH wallet etc are banned from the bounty

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: As I mentioned before, we didn't suspend people just because they use TOR. But from the IP they used, there are 30+ other registrations, they will be suspended. Many websites won't even let you register as a precautionary measure if your IP is already in there system connected with another account. I'm sure many might disagree, however this are our rules, else we would end up handing out 90% of the tokens to cheaters.

Author: Noizie
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Sorry Peter, in my humble opinion the whole bounty campaign turns out to become a big disaster. Why?  Banning (as it seems) everyone coming through VPN/Thor, even the upliner who gave reflink. It's not "my" fault if a downline starts cheating or uses Thor. Many in other people in this world use Thor for reasons which are _not_ cheating related. Banning multiple IP is harsh. There's no 1 person = 1 ip! F.e. here in germany you don't get a static ip as a costumer. IP changes often so the chance that someone has the same ip as you had is very close. IP pools of telekom providers are limited. This also kicks out : University campus, Schools, companies and so on. What about the people who do not have access to their reflink?   That should have been mentioned in the first place to KEEP that! Also the withdraw form is a big ****, sorry to say that. To me it seems very unsafe. What if someone knows mailadress and reflink? He could put any name and Wallet address into the form and gets the tokens! No confirmation needed except for a useless captcha.  I get calls from friends who i certainly know are _not_ cheating that their account seems to be suspended. I know that some of them use thor, many of them use email account (which my company provides), some use other mail accounts. We did huge promotion in our Media and crypto related communities and now everything gone down the drain.  Sure you have to clean out the cheaters, no doubt. But in my opinion there is to much collateral damage in the wrong direction. Id rather give some tokens to a cheater instead of kicking 50% of the honest peoples out.

Author: hunnykaushal
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: This is to inform All of you who are asking questions here, must read this post.  1. Question : Which Wallet we can use to get ATS Tokens?       Answer : ATS is an Ethereum ERC-20 Token and can be accessed by any Ethereum wallet supporting tokens. If you need a recommendation, most users prefer to use myetherwallet.com (if you want a mobile wallet, imToken (token.im) is fully compatible too, we got in contact with their team and our ATS tokens have been included in their default supported tokens as well). For myetherwallet.com , you need to add ATS as a custom token to be able to see your balance. Please see this post for the info you need to add: http://authorship.com/2017/08/01/how-do-i-view-ats-tokens-in-my-wallet/ DO NOT enter an Ethereum address from an exchange (ex: poloniex, bittrex, coinbase, etc.) or you will lose your ATS tokens. Once the tokens are sent, this can’t be undone.  2. Question : How we can withdraw out bounty campaign free ATS if didn't get any email from Authorship ?     Answer : you can withdraw you Bounty campaign ATS token from this link http://authorship.com/withdraw/  3. Question : I get this email when i withdraw for my bounty campaign ATS "var amount = 0;"     Answer : Don't worry about this , Ignore it.  4. Question : I have a question , where i can ask it to team of Authorship ?     Answer : Ask here or contact them at contact@authorship.com  All the best. Thank you

Author: TheCryproMaster
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hey all, I've come across a potentially disturbing error regarding copying and pasting your eth address key from myetherwallet to the ATS withdrawal screen. I'd urge everyone to recheck the address they provided. I sent this email just now to the support team and hope Peter is around to comment.  Hi,  Apologies for causing this extra work, but there is an issue with copying eth wallet address from myethwallet to your withdraw eth screen. I did a straight forward copy/paste and on investigating and for some weird reason a numeral was missed. This address is what i pasted 0xDdB82b92f1B66423b545E2c4db92f2b2483fEae But the correct address is this 0xDdB82b92f1B66423b545FE2c4db92f2b2483fEae The F is missing after 423b545. I have no idea why this would happen, and I'm thinking I'm not the only person this has happened too.  Please can you amend the eth address to 0xDdB82b92f1B66423b545FE2c4db92f2b2483fEae if its not too late in my case, and hope this hasn't happened to other people.  Thanks,  Would welcome comments if anyone else has experienced this problem.  C

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: I'd like to update everyone here that is has become impossible to keep track of everyone's comments and questions.  If you have an issue, and you believe it's something that can be fixed, please email us and you'll hear back from us. However, please be patient as we have almost 1,500 emails in queue. It may take a couple days to receive a reply.  Please keep in mind:  -IF you entered a wrong ETH address on the withdrawal form, you CANNOT change it anymore. You've been offered numerous occasions to make sure you enter the correct one and unfortunately, you agreed to the final ETH address by submitting the form.  -We cannot tell you what your name/email/referral/eth or any other info you need to know about your account. Please search for your welcome email if you need the referral link, check your friends or places you shared with if you cannot find it.  -Please do not send us stories about why your 50 identical IP registrations are legit. (we heard it all , starting from knocking door to door with your laptop in your hand asking people if they want free tokens; or that you work as a nurse at the hospital and you asked 200 patients to give you their email addresses as a way of raising funds for a noble cause; or that you asked your 600 friends to gather at your house, at a big round table), you'll be suspended.  -If you strongly believe your account was suspended and you are 100% sure you did nothing wrong, please send us an email describing how you promoted your link, with proof (please no stories). Please understand however, that if we check the situation and see the suspension was the right thing to do, we won't even bother to reply back. We don't have the time to argue nor the desire.  However, if we mistakenly got your account suspended we will reinstate it and send you all the earned ATS plus a 5% bonus for the situation. So far, we encountered no case where we've been wrong; but we are not excluding the possibility.  -Do not email us to ask "when I'll receive the tokens/where are my tokens/why I didn't received the tokens". Please. This info is public.  Thank you, Peter

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: For the moment we are busy distributing the tokens. Completing this step is required before any exchange can list us. I'll have more updated in the coming days as things calm down a bit.  Thank you, Peter
