Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: I just registered at this forum since I couldn't keep my mouth shut anymore due to the laziness/retardness of quite some newbies here. C'mon guys, please read this whole thread first and you will find your answer you're looking for. (THERE's AN SEARCH OPTION, please USE it!) But please take your time / pay attention first before screaming or crying for help since it's so annoying. And please do some freakin' research regarding crypto coins and ethereum wallets and etc. and also check out the official website of authorship about this awesome ats coin first since a lot of you are probably here because of the 'free' coins.  I don't want to offend you all and i'm surely not pointing to all of you but please do your freakin' research since it's not that difficult to understand. To me, Peter is doing an awesome job and has so much patient, respect dude! And your answers are so clearly to me though I'm still new to crypto coins...  Let's make Authorship a great platform and let's go to the moon and beyond, maybe pluto! lol I'll definitely stick with the coins for a long time and even invested some ETH.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Here's the thing, we have no issue with someone using TOR. However they provide a limited number of IPs. Cheaters are known to using TOR, they created thousands of accounts from TOR IPs, I doubt there's a single IP we haven't recorded. As such, if you use TOR, the chances are there are probably dozens of accounts already created from the IP you've been assigned. As a result, you'll be suspended.

Your account submitted email address was found in our system and your withdrawal request will be processed soon to the ETH address you provided. Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Because this is the price the trading will start from. Who is going to sell for 4 cents and why? If investors would sell for 4 cents, they will get a little profit, doubt they are interested in a 20% profit. Bounty hunters, again, are interested to sell for as high as possible; after all they only got 75 ATS, if they sell for 4 cents they make $3, not really worth it.  Plus, you can see here why the ATS has all the conditions to have a minimum price of $0.15 here: http://authorship.com/2017/08/26/what-is-the-price-of-ats/

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Don't think we will reach that high, the DDoS pretty much scared some investors as things seem to have slowed down. Most people unfortunately aren't too knowledgeable about this matters and they assume something could go wrong; although it can't.  On the bright side of things however, this means they will buy from exchanges instead since their interest is still up.  From our point of view, we have raised what we needed to turn the platform into a success and provided us with a great marketing budget to reach the users base we need.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: After you receive them you can do anything you want with them  However, it's unlikely to see them listed today/tomorrow through exchanges, unless some decide this on their own (the ones we approached asked us to update them once the ICO is over and the tokens distributed).

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: The link will be sent about an hour after the ICO is over. There 6 hours left of the ICO, so in 7 hours time the form will be available.  As far as exchanges go, as mentioned, we approached Bittrex, had our account verified, provided them with all the info and been told to update them when the ICO is over and the tokens distributed. Not sure how long it takes from this point, but I'd imagine not much.  As far as the investors go, once the ICO is over we'll begin processing the withdrawals, we expect all investors to receive the tokens within 24 hours max.  Regards, Peter

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hi everyone, We apologize for being on and off, it is what it is.. as the DDoS never stopped it's been running for almost 12 hours now.  The attack will end at some point and everyone will receive it's share of ATS tokens (bought or earned). This is a guarantee.  While we initially wanted to postpone the end of the ICO we have decided not to as we cannot know for how long the attack will continue, we'll take the "hit" and apologize to the investors unable to get into as planned.  There are at this point exactly 12 hours left until the ICO will officially end.  If you believe in our project and want to invest, you have 12 hours left to do it. The investors ATS tokens will begin to be processed, automatically and without any confirmation needed from their side 2 hours after the ICO ended. We expect all investors to receive their ATS tokens within 24 hours from the end of the ICO, assuming we can access the website in a decent time manner. A maximum of 48 hours delay is possible.  The withdrawal form for the free bounty campaign will be published (assuming we have access at the server at that time; if not at the first time possible) 2 hours after the ICO is over as well. Please be advised, that because the attack is still running, the website may be unavailable at times and can slow down the processing of the withdrawals.  I've seen a couple referring to us as a "scam" already. Please DON'T. Probably this is what whoever is behind the attack intention was, considering the perfect image our ICO had from day 1 'till the very end.  Thank you, Peter

Body: Hi, Is it most likely that others used the same PC and tried watching the custom token, but with wrong data (this is why it's showing 3 times), this is why you saw the ATS showing, as nothing get saved on myetherwallet servers, everything is saved locally (cookies).

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: The website is under DDoS (flooding our website), not being hacked, which is a completely different thing.  The ATS are safe, nothing is saved/hosted on the server, so there is nothing to worry about. Worst case scenario: there will be a short delay in distributing the free ATS as the website is on and off and you need to complete the withdrawal form. But for investors, there is zero impact.  Thank you, Peter

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: The issue is that most investors plan to invest in the last 24 hours, it is a common of ICOs and probably this is the reason behind the attack. We received tons of messages about this from investors.  The way things are looking (18.94 Gb/s currently), we may be forced to postpone it for some time if the DDoS lasts for long.  -Peter

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hi and thank you for your message.  On our T&C that refers to the price you are paying for 1 ATS, not the value of 1 ATS. This is why it's saying that the minimum number of ATS you can receive for 1 ETH is 2000. Tho that should have been updated to ~4500 as we changed the maximum amount we would raise to $7M, so the minimum amount increased as well.  How many ATS you receive when the ICO is over can be calculated by dividing the 100M tokens to the amount we raise.  If we raise $7M (~21,000 ETH) , for 1 ETH invested you will receive 5,000 ATS (100M / 21000 =~5000 ATS) If we raise $5M (~15,000 ETH) , for 1 ETH invested you will receive 6,600 ATS (100M / 15000 = 6600 ATS) If we raise $3M (~9,000 ETH) , for 1 ETH invested you will receive 11,000 ATS If we raise $2M (~6,000 ETH) , for 1 ETH invested you will receive 16,600 ATS  Regarding the project roadmap, it is expected to be officially launched on June 1st 2018.  Regards, Peter

Author: beket
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hello Peter,  I've already invested to your platform and have a strong idea to invest some more as it seems to be very useful project. I myself fond of reading and having one space for all the worldwide events in book industry is really awesome)  If you wouldn't mind I have some questions to be solid clear with. Well some points may already been asked here so I apologize if it was so.   I talked to Dave recently and he said that it's everything settled with the bittrex exchange and token trading launch would be in no time there. And what about Poloniex? Do you plan to start on both platforms at one time?  Have one confusing contradiction. Well, as an investor, I want to be clear with ATS tokens primal trading price. On your website I found this statement: "...1 ATS will have a recommended starting trading price, through exchanges of $0.15 (15 cents), no matter what amount we raise..." But while reading Terms and Conditions of your ICO I noted absolutely different statement to one I mentioned above: "...ATS Price 1 ETH will purchase a minimum of 2000 ATS. The exact price will be determined when the sale ends using the formula: 1 ATS = Total Amount Raised / 100.000.000 tokens..."  I wonder what is true and which investor can take as a reference?  Q about the roadmap. I wanted to see it on the website, but it seems to be down now. Just want to know When Exactly The Athorship Platform Starts To Work as a ... just like retail version?  Last one - you said that upon the end of ICO campaign 100 mln ATS tokens would be divided to the whole contributed sum in eth equivalent. But on the website it is stated that 80% of the 100 mln ATS would be delivered to investors. So, according to this I understand that not 100 mln must be divided but 80 mln? Or am I wrong? And how fiat funds would be converted to eth and at what rate?  Thank you for your time and for making all these clear for me.  I wish your platform stable growth in the future.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: DDoS protection is running, but unfortunately, it's blocking a lot of legitimate hits, so it's not much we can do until the DDoS stops. About half of legitimate hits seem to be also blocked, me included.  Depending on the duration of the attack we may extend the duration of the ICO with another 24-48 hours, depending on the time we are offline as lots of investors seems to have wanted to invest in the last day and now they can't. We received lots of messages on Facebook about this as our emails are not working at this moment.  It's quite unfortunate that this is happening, and I apologize for the situation. Unfortunately it's not something we can do at this point but wait.  Will keep everyone updated.  Thank you, Peter

Body: I think this should be self explanatory just by looking at this thread where 9 in 10 people do not even have 15 cents worth of ether to pay for the gas fee. As mentioned before, most investors are new to cryptocurrencies, many of them are authors from our business (Serious Reading). We provided credit card statements before when requested, and will also provide after the ICO is over for transparency. Transparency is something everyone congratulated us for. Thank you

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: You will receive the ATS tokens regardless if you have or not. When you want to send the tokens from your wallet to another wallet (ex: an exchange), this is when you need to pay a small fee (usually it's 0.0004 ETH ~ $0.15). This is how the Ethereum network works.

Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: I'm a newbie just like you, but as far as  i know even if your ETH balance is ZERO you can still receive the token as long as your wallet is an ERC 20 token compliant ex. My Ether Wallet (MEW) not the wallet from exchanges. But if you want to send your token to another wallet that's were you need the Balance for the Transaction fees. Which by default is 21000 GAS = 0.02 Cents = 0.0008 ETH =  0.00000512 BTC = 512 Satoshi

Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors

Author: Grim149x
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: QUESTIONS & ANSWERS (Please correct my mistakes to make this accurate.)  Q: When will we receive our ATS tokens? A: Starting Sep 14 once you fill out the final form.     In addition, you'll have 45 days to complete the withdrawal.     You'll receive the ATS 2-3 days upon completing the form.  Q: Can I still change my eth address used? A: Yes, you'll have your last chance starting Sep 14.  Q: Will there be any fee? A: Yes, sending tokens by default will require around 0.0004 Ether.  Q: Will we still receive the form if we unsubscribed to the mailing list? A: Authorship was aware of that, so they will also put out the form on their website.  Q: When will we see ATS on exchanges? A: Every exchange has it's own listing timeline: some list them within 3-4 days while some take several weeks. One thing is for sure: they will be available through exchanges by the end of the month. -Peter   -Nikko Acaya

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Considering that: - this is the price everyone who earned the ATS through the bounty campaign is going to sell for. Ask anyone who got the free ATS and they will tell you that. The price is all over the web. - investors would have no reason to sell it for less than this. If an investor would sell for this low as you said (2 cents), it would mean he sells at a loss, would make no sense for anyone to do it. - most investors aren't looking to sell now, but keep the ATS at least until next year when we launch the platform - the shortage of available tokens once we hit the market thanks to the limited number of investors looking to sell and the sudden demand (we have loads of investors who mentioned they'll buy 5x-10x more once they see us on an exchange) can only make the price go up - there will always be some who sell, but from all that I presented above, I tend to believe the balance is surely not in their favor  This is my personal opinion considering the facts and should not be taken as a guarantee.  -Peter

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: We know people most of the time don't enter their correct first/last name, so we won't make it a requirement.  It will be on the form, but it won't be a requirement in order to have their withdrawal processed.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Definitely not. You can hold your ATS for as long as you want. You can exchange them 5 years from now if you wish to, there is no problem.  Most investors aren't looking to exchange their tokens at least until next year when we'll launch the platform.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: 1. The Ethereum address is where you receive the tokens. You can have any number of different tokens, all received to the same ETH address, this is how the Ethereum network works. You cannot have an "ATS address" only. All addresses are Ethereum addresses.  2. The contract address is the same for everyone, it's the token contract address which is mentioned on our page.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Everyone will have up to 45 days at their disposal to complete the form and withdraw their earned tokens.  We prefer to use this approach rather than hear them saying they sent us their coinbase/poloniex/bittrex/etc address and lost the tokens. 90% of the emails we receive are about this, so if 9 in 10 people filled a wrong address, it's something we will ask people to do.

Body: Great thing! I just wanted to start another mailing for my groups but it's to late now as I see.  Question to the pros: Do we have to add ATS token to myetherwallet in advance of the distribution? Will they be lost if they are sent and ATS is not added to myetherwallet manually before that?

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: myetherwallet is  just an interface to access an Ethereum address. Nothing is saved on their website. It doesn't influence receiving or anything else regarding the address, so you will still receive the ATS tokens.  You can find here the info you need to add to see the tokens in your balance: http://authorship.com/2017/08/01/how-do-i-view-ats-tokens-in-my-wallet/

Author: expertartist
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hello Peter!  What was I supposed to enter in ETH address? I made an account through myetherwallet and copied Public Key (Account Address) and pasted in ETH address field.  I am confused now. I know we'll get an opportunity to correct the address but I still want to know. What is this Add Custom Coin procedure? Were we supposed to take anything from that way?  I clicked on Add Custom Token and it returned:  Address (field)  Token Symbol  Decimals  Please explain, was my ETH address correct? or we were supposed to complete Add Custom Coin procedure and take an address from there? (I don't see any address there though)

Author: Darkoth89
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Excellent, congratulations on a really well done campaign guys! Upwards and onwards to the ICO now!

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: You entered the correct thing: the public address; this is what it's needed.  The "add custom token" procedure is something you do on myetherwallet to be able to SEE the tokens and interact with them (send) after you receive them. Else myetherwallet will show only how much Ether you have in your balance by default, not the tokens you also own. It doesn't influence when you do it.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: You will have to fill the withdrawal form just as a precaution method. It only takes 30 seconds.  We've been bombarded with emails these days, 9 out of 10 emails we receive ask us to change their registered ETH address, so we figured to give everyone a final chance to double check their ETH address to make sure they don't lose their ATS tokens.  On 14th, once the token sale is over, we'll publish the withdrawal form.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: We are looking on it, and there'll surely be some leftovers after we clean everything. Don't think we'll do a second bounty camp as there's little time left, but maybe we can find a formula to distribute them. Will keep everyone posted.

Body: I just went through my Coinomi to see if the ATS token is among the listed ones but I did not see it there. But there is means to add it provided it is ERC20 supported. I went through the support and I saw there is opportunity to add the tokens provided we have the info. When I clicked on the "+" button to add it, it brought a form to fill which is as follows:  NAME = DESCRIPTION = WEBSITE = CONTRACT ADDRESS = CONTRACT SUIT = (Token template or default) CONTRACT ABI =  I FILLED IT AS FOLLOWS:  NAME = Authorship Token DESCRIPTION = ATS WEBSITE = http://authorship.com CONTRACT ADDRESS = 0x2dAEE1AA61D60A252DC80564499A69802853583A CONTRACT SUIT = Token template CONTRACT ABI =  I don't know the contract ABI and in the contract suit, should I leave it as "Token Template" or "default"? Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hi everyone, We want to announce that our Authorship Bounty Campaign just ended: http://authorship.com/2017/09/09/authorship-bounty-campaign-ended/  All the available 1,000,000 ATS tokens have been allocated to members joining our bounty campaign. The earned ATS tokens will be distributed once the token sale is over (14th Sept). We will publish an update about this on 14th Sept after the token sale ended.  If you believe you entered a wrong ETH address or want to change your receiving ETH address there is no need to contact us about. You’ll have the opportunity to do it on 14th Sept, as you’ll be asked to complete an withdrawal form as a final confirmation. A newsletter will be sent on 14th Sept, but in case you miss it, please check our blog as you’ll find a copy here as well.  ATS is an Ethereum ERC-20 Token and can be accessed by any Ethereum wallet supporting tokens. If you need a recommendation, most users prefer to use myetherwallet.com (if you want a mobile wallet, imToken (token.im) is fully compatible too, we got in contact with their team and our ATS tokens have been included in their default supported tokens as well). For myetherwallet.com , you need to add ATS as a custom token to be able to see your balance. Please see this post for the info you need to add: http://authorship.com/2017/08/01/how-do-i-view-ats-tokens-in-my-wallet/  DO NOT enter an Ethereum address from an exchange (ex: poloniex, bittrex, coinbase, etc.) or you will lose your ATS tokens. Once the tokens are sent, this can’t be undone.  We would like to thank everyone for the participation and especially to our top promoters below!  If you enjoyed the free ATS tokens and want to benefit from having more of them, we’d be happy to see you among our investors as well. You can buy ATS tokens with Ether (ETH) from our Contributions page:  http://authorship.com/contribute/  Thank you! -Peter

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hi, Thank you for the message and for the interest in our project.  This will not get you banned. It can get your account flagged for inspection, but once it's inspected and we see it's nothing but genuine registrations, nothing will happen. Also, if we have doubts, we'll email you about to inquire about the promotion methods you used.  Accounts get suspended only after a human review, there's nothing automated that suspends accounts as automation could sometimes go wrong. So, there is nothing to worry about.  Also, the free ATS tokens and the investments are different, there's no connection between the two in terms of receiving them. So, assuming that by some unknown mistake (which didn't happened to date and surely won't happen) an account will get suspended and it loses the free ATS, it doesn't influence the receiving of the ATS from investing as these are separate. To buy ATS tokens one deposits ETH to our ETH address and in exchange we send the ATS to the address we received the investment from. We do not know or check if that person has or not a free ATS account also.  Hope this clears your questions. For anything else please let me know.  Thank you, Peter

Author: Benezim
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: It doesn't need to be converted to ETH because ATS is an ERC-20 token. ETH wallets can hold ETH and all ERC-20 tokens, in the same wallet address. Make sure you control the private keys, so don't send ETH from an exchange like Bittrex etc  https://tokenmarket.net/what-is/how-to-participate-ethereum-token-crowdsale/

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hi, ATS is an Ethereum token (please read this article to understand what an ethereum token is http://www.investopedia.com/news/what-erc20-and-what-does-it-mean-ethereum/)  Ethereum tokens are being held in the same Ethereum address just as you hold Ether.  Here's an analogy: an Ethereum address is like a real physical wallet. In a real wallet you can hold USD, EUR, GBP etc..  Same goes for an Ethereum address. It can hold Ether, but as the same time it can also hold any number of Ethereum tokens like ATS is.  When you check your Ethereum address you can see that you have 10 Ether in there but also have 500 ATS. They are totally different things. You cannot convert them one to another just with some math, or by moving some decimal as you mentioned. Even tho it can be some sort of relation between them (the same way there's a price connection between real USD and EUR), you cannot turn one into another without going through an exchange. If you want to exchange USD into EUR how do you do? You use an exchange (like your bank). Same goes for converting tokens like ATS is to anything else like ETH/BTC. You need to use an exchange like Bittrex for example.  Hope this clear it for you. For any questions, please let me know.  Regards, Peter

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: eliminate 80% of signups? Curious cause it seems only about 0.5% of registrations seem to come from temporary emails. Never figured 8 in 10 people use temporary emails. Probably because they DON'T? I personally never used one and I am yet to have a close one use one either.  If you are afraid of spam, you can always mark it as spam and you never get to see another email from that sender.  If you used a temporary email and are the only referral don't worry. But if I see you have a dozen referrals all using temp emails , I think it's safe to conclude what is going on with that usage.

Author: Noizie
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: It looks kinda stupid when you give a "hotbunny1999@trashmail.com" address to your bank or a office ;-) He said, he uses his real address for banking ;-) Of course some companies sell your email address and you could be flooded with spam. Then, for god sake, get a trashmail address for singnups at xxx, casino, dating or whatever sites. Your brain is the best spamfilter. But concerning the ICO bounty, i'd rather have a collateral damage in the false refs then kicking out even one _real_ ref. When my company did such things like a ref campaign or e-mail signup campaign for a client I learned that you have to live with 5% cheaters. It is much more expansive (manpower) to filter them compared to just live with them.

Author: DutchFinity
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Question: When a reader-user of the platform wants to order your book (first possible sale), and the publishers make their offers to the author, will their offer regard the printing of that one single book, or will an agreement be reached for future orders as well? If so; will there also be options to negotiate a number of copies or a deadline whereafter new negotiations must follow?    P.s. As an author I am interested in this project but I think the name is a bit unlucky as it will appeal mostly to authors. A name like 'Literature coin' would more easily have caught the eye of readers and publishers as well. Anyway, it's now to late to change that.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hi, Our intention is to compete with Amazon one day.  Once the platform will be launched it will be made available in several languages, that won't be a problem.  Regarding the books quality, every book will go through an initial inspection before being listed. And once it got listed, readers reviews and ratings will determine if a book remains or not listed on the platform. This way we can eliminate the bad ones. As far as translations go, every translator will earn up reputation points based on the quality he provides. Te higher the reputation, the more trusted a translator becomes and more sales he will attract. Readers will be able to rate the translators. Also, several pages of the book will be provided as a preview before one gets to buy the book to get a sense of the quality.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: An author will have the option to "lock" itself with just 1 publisher if he wants to (reach an exclusive agreement), or have his books work on a auction based system when it comes to printing and delivery.  Each publisher will have the option to offer discounts for bulk orders as well, directly to readers on the shopping cart.  As far as the name goes, I'll have to disagree. "Authorship" has an authoritative sound, it's catchy, easy to remember and caters to everyone. After all people don't go to Amazon, because the "word Amazon" screams "buy books" either It's all about building a brand.  Regards, Peter

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Only 1% of the number of tokens were offered through the bounty campaign, thus too little to have a real impact.  There will be no unclaimed and unsold tokens. There is a total of 100M tokens, 20M are reserved for authors and 80M are being distributed to investors who participated through this ICO. No matter what amount we raise, all the tokens will be distributed to investors proportionally to their investment amount.

Body: Hello I just want to know this especially how tokens work like ATS. Once token released to all who earned/invested, can we immediately change it to btc? Even tokens without on exchanges yet?.  Like ATS convert to Eth (myetherwallet) then BTC other wallet. Is it possible?. And how about the value?. Thanks!

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: All tokens need to be listed through exchanges in order to be exchanged.  There's no magic that converts one token to another, it's people through exchanges that buy/sell their tokens for others.  When you exchange ATS to BTC for example, you sell your ATS to buy BTC and someone else in return SELL his BTC to buy your ATS.  Regards, Peter

So, even if we raise $3M or $4M, all 80M tokens will be distributed to everyone who invested.  Regards, Peter

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Rest assured, we have our means of banning just the people who deserves it. You won't be banned because you sent us 5 visitors and this resulted in 5 registrations. But if you send us 100 visitors and this results in 100 registrations, something is surely not right.  We won't disclose all our protection means, as this would open the door to cheaters to try to prevent them. People who aren't doing anything wrong, don't need to worry.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hi, No you cannot mine this. There is a fixed total supply of 100M , and 80M are being offered to investors now through the ICO.  You can find our project roadmap at the bottom of the homepage.  As far as the team goes, the company leaders are being publicly displayed (CEO and CDO). From what I am ware, this is what companies do (not talking about ICOs), but companies. If I check the About Us page of any company I'll find the management team, not the junior php programmers.  Surely not the CEO does all the coding or website design, and I believe everyone understands this. Our team has many members, but for various privacy reasons we won't list them. They did not hire for a job to be used as a marketing tool. Nonetheless, we will list some of them which will agree with this in the next days, if everyone is so keen on seeing more faces. Personally I don't see how adding 6 more people's faces on our page adds more value to the project, but if this is what the community wants, will try to partially comply.  Regards, Peter

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: We noticed this and we suspend all ref links what we find to be involved in spam activities. This seems to be a general issue with ref links and unfortunately it's not something we can control. We make it very clear that we don't allow this and who's been caught spamming will get suspended.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: When you call someone a scam you also need to elaborate as to the facts that make it one.  Mind asking to elaborate how the ICO failed if we already raised $2.5M ?  Have you checked our About Us page also? We aren't a company born yesterday, we are in the publishing industry for years, with thousands of authors interviews and book reviews as proof for anyone to verify, with another fully developed platform, proof of our developing capabilities.  As such, I'd appreciate if you due some due diligence before leaving such messages. Assuming you did any, to begin with and aren't just trolling us.  Thank you, Peter

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: The thing with VPN is that they have a pretty limited number of IPs they provide. Once more people try to register using the same VPNs, we get to catch most of them.  Also, a common among cheaters is that they rarely bother to provide real names/emails. They mostly use generated ones a human will spot in a second. We also check several other things like the number of visitors through the referral link and the conversion rate to registrations. Too high and you're flagged for an inspection.  While some may slip through the filters, I'd say we are good at catching at least 95% of them.  Plus we have one last "surprise" for them..can't disclose it now, but you'll all hear about it soon

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: If I may add some information, as I believe this is of interest to investors as it's part of what Authorship is already developing:  "The U.S. government has awarded a $100,000 grant to a group of researchers looking to apply blockchain to public library systems." (https://www.coindesk.com/librarychain-us-government-grants-100k-new-blockchain-research/)  https://www.imls.gov/grants/awarded/LG-98-17-0209-17  "The San Jose State University School of Information iSchool will investigate ways that blockchain technology can be used by libraries to partner with other organizations and to support city or community goals. Blockchain technology is a shared digital/electronic ledger featuring a constantly updated list of transactions. It is supported by a peer-to-peer network that may be either public or private. This technology has the potential to help libraries develop a distributed metadata system; facilitate better digital rights management; and create a protocol for supporting community based collections. The proposed National Forum would bring together 20-30 technical experts in libraries, blockchain technology, and urban planning to discuss ways that blockchain technology can advance library services to support city or community goals. The resulting commentary from a project blog, national forum, and conference and the survey data will be evaluated and included in the project's final report, which will be available online. The recommendations will serve as a guide for both large and small, urban and rural libraries to implement blockchain technology or consider other directions."  Authorship is already one step in front of what the U.S. gov is just researching, proof that what we are trying to accomplish is something many (including US gov) are looking forward to.  Regards, Peter

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: I think you wanted to say ICO not ISO.  As I mentioned previously, it won't affect us. US doesn't want to block all ICOs, the issues are with the ones that fall under "securities". As long as a token is being meant to be used as a currency, there are no issues.  Yes, there will probably be a little more paper work to be done, but that's quite a common when you try to build a successful company.  We already raised over the minimum $500K amount, thus nothing bad can happen. You will receive the ATS tokens once the ICO is over (14th Sept).  When you have a question, it's better you email us instead of just leaving a comment throughout several hundred comments on Facebook.  Regards, Peter

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hi, There would be no problem. As long as the referrals are legit there is nothing for you to worry about.  Regarding your friend question, ATS has nothing to do with that. We are a company who's been in the publishing industry for years, we already successfully developed a writer's platform as proof of our capabilities. In simple words: failing to complete this project is not an option for us.  If your friend need any other clarifications, have him email contact@authorship.com and we'll gladly get back to him.  Regards, Peter

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hi, As per the SEC guidelines, we do not fall under "securities". Our tokens are meant to be used as a currency, as such as long as we can provide transparency, all is in order.  As far as China goes, worst case scenario, we aren't allowed to accept deposits from Chinese investors, besides that there's no real impact.  Regards, Peter

Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: peterauthorship:  All I've seen so far is positive about this project but...   So I was in group chat and they were talking about ICOs so I jumped right in and asked them what do they think about ATS.  A particular member said that:  "The technology sucks."  "I invest in NEO 100% but ATS, a big no."  "I checked IT Network about the developer and I can't see them"  She also said:  "Don't milk it."   So I stopped replying as she seem very rude.  Can you please clarify what do you think she's saying and what's your stand on that? I have 100+ referrals so far and plan to go for 200 as my next goal, but what she said demotivated me. I still believe in the project as it's the best so far in my opinion.  Thank you in advance.

Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors

As far as our developing capabilities goes, if anyone has doubts, can easily check DotWriter.com , a platform we already built ourselves. We don't reinvent Ethereum, we only use it.  Thank you, Peter

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: BEWARE of phishing attempts:  It was just brought to my attention that someone registered the .LTD version of our domain and created a clone of our website changing just the ETH address.  I already reported the domain to the registrar and the hosting company. I'm waiting for their reply now.  I would like to ask the community for help: anytime you see a message/place where the .LTD domain is being advertised by this scammer, please take a moment to leave a comment and let everyone know about this. I see he started leaving messages to a couple youtube videos. The sooner we all act, the sooner we will take this down so that nobody falls for this scam.  Thank you, Peter CDO Authorship.com

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hi, 1. We expect investors to be on profit from the first day this hits exchanges.  2. We contacted both Poloniex and Bittrex and are in the process with both of them of sending all the required info, getting accounts verified, etc. We also decided to also use a third party service that will speed up the exchanges listing and for that we picked Ambisafe. Their connections can help us get there faster than we can by our own (https://www.ambisafe.co/exchange-listing-assistance/).  3. Cryptocurrencies can only grow if they have a real world usage. ATS is meant to be the currency transactions will be done on the Authorship platform. When tens of thousands of authors will accept ATS for book sales, this will no longer represent "a less known world" as you referred to. We also plan to build a dedicated ATS wallet to make it easier for readers to purchase ATS.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: This is 100% possible and I truly believe $0.15 is just the minimum price.  Let me offer you just a quick explanation, as to how easy it is for ATS to have a minimum value of $0.15  There are a total of 100M ATS tokens. At a price of $0.15 per token, it results a total Market Cap value of $15M.  Do you know how many coins have a market cap above $15M? (over 200 coins!). Out of the total of ~1000 coins in existence, 200 of them have a market cap of over $15M.  This means that we only need to be one of the top 200 coins to have a minimum value of $0.15. If we make it into the top 100 coins, the value will be 3 times higher.  Taking in consideration that our platform is completely unique, I don't know of a single coin out there who competes with us, as such I dare to say, without a doubt, that it's impossible we are not better than 80% of the coins out there (excuse my lack of modesty, but we truly believe in the platform we are building).  Sincerely, Peter

Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors

If your referrals have no idea what cryptocurencies are and start filling the "ETH address field" with random data, this might flag your account as well. Also, you are not allowed to ask them to use your ETH address either.  Dozens of referrals all with the same ETH address can be flagged as well.

Author: GaleRecoN
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: I'm a bit confused by the 1 ATS value for the contribution. In the picture it says 1ETH = 16,600ATS if $2M raised, then it says 1ETH = 3,300ATS if $10M raised. Does this mean that the price of ATS per 1ETH will depend on the amount raised after the ICO is over? Or if I donate before you reach the $2M raised mark I will get 16,600ATS per 1ETH and if I donate after $10M raised I will only get 3,300ATS per 1ETH?  If the second is true, does that means that if I contribute 1ETH now, I'm expecting to receive 16,600ATS? Thanks for the clarification.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hi, The amount of ATS you receive depends on the total amount raised. It doesn't matter when you invest, all that matters is the total amount raised at the end of the ICO. That determines how many ATS you will receive for 1 ETH. All investors will receive the same price. We only offered a 20% bonus in the first 5 days of the ICO.  The idea behind this is to stop overselling (a common issue of ICOs). This way, people will stop investing more money into the ICO after a certain point (say after we reach $5M) since they would not receive the same level of ROI if they do.  Our aim is to raise only an amount that allows us to build the platform; not 20 times more cash than we need. When one raises too much money, it does it on investors expense (the tokens will be overvalued, so you'll see them go down in price instead of going up). By making sure we have that middle limit, we can be sure that both parties win (We, Authorship can build the platform with the funds we received, and investors earn as well as the tokens can only increase in price thanks to the limited supply).  Hope this clears it.  Regards, Peter

Author: Flodner
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Well, if someone wants to join ICO, to invest money, but doesn't have ETH or doesn't even know much about cryptocurrencies - than I see no problem to help to get ETH wallet, and transfer cash (bank money) to ETH and then to Tokens. Or may be just directly to tokens

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: In theory, yes. However many of the authors (and people) we work with had little knowledge about cryptocurrencies, had no verified accounts on platforms where they can buy ETH (so it will take another couple weeks just to get verified to be able to buy), as such, we don't see the problem with accepting credit card/wire investments. After all, before the crypto fever started, all crowdsales happened this way (credit card/wire).

Author: cryptomipher
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Honestly, none of the reasons you mentioned qualify. In fact they prove the contrary, the reason a Smart Contract is CREATED, is to make sure: - fixed supply volume is respected! - the price value changing - It is true a Smart Contract is only for ETH, however that is definetly not an excuse not to have a Smart Contract. I would rather use ETH on a publicly available smart contract than an Address! - Yes a Smart Contract can allocate for bounties... (seriously?) - An address (mostly probably no even a multi-sig address) is the worst possible trust you can have.  I call this ICO a SCAM!  The reply from the owner of that address makes the matter clearer.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Well it seems there is no point to argue with you. You are caught on your scam assessment and whatever I'd add would not convince you otherwise.  Our token contract is published and verifiable, source code is verified on etherscain.io, anyone can see the total fixed supply which can't be changed.  I stated my facts. I'm curious to see a smart contract that is going to issue tokens after someone wires money to a bank account. Or who issues tokens after someone clicks on a share button.  What do you think we are going to do? Get people ETH and don't issue the ATS tokens? What would be the point?  We probably aren't running a company for 3 years either and all the 1000+ author interviews from our website are fake too (http://seriousreading.com/category/author-interviews).  Probably DotWriter, the other company we built, wasn't on adtech either (curious cause there are even photos available online as proof). Here's just one for you:    Here's also the proof that DotWriter got acquired by a Global Ad Network as well: https://dotwriter.com/blog/15467/dotwriter-com-gets-acquired-global-ad-network-mediastinct/  Feel free to buy our ATS AFTER you'll see us on exchanges in a month's time then. At the end of the day we can't convince everyone and don't plan to either.  Regards, Peter

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hi, This was posted a few pages ago, here is the explanation:  About the ICO address, yes, it's not a contract address and this is something many ICOs use instead of a contract. The reasons are various, but for our particular case:  -unlike ICOs that have an infinite supply of issued tokens, we don't. We have a fixed supply volume of 100M tokens.  -some ICOs have a predetermined token price. We don't. 1 ETH = 2000 ATS minimum, but it can get higher than this based on the total amount raised. (please look on out page to see how it gets calculated)  -besides ETH, we also accept credit card and wire deposits. A contract could not handle that.  -a smart contract could have not handled our referral bounty campaign. The free ATS tokens have to be distributed manually.  -right about the time when we were deciding if we should go with a contract or an address and how things should be, there were a few instance of exploited contracts and we wanted to make sure we don't risk it. An address poses no such security risks.  PS: Our ATS tokens contract source code is verified on etherscain.io as well.  Regards, Peter

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hi, We are aware many share the same IPs for reasonable reasons, so, we won't suspend your account just because ONE of your referrals triggered this. However, when we see that you sent us 30 referrals and all 30 share the same IP with yours, we definitely can't accept that was legit. Having the same IP as one of your referrals will trigger your account for a manual review. The manual review is the only one that can suspend your account.  The bounty campaign will run until the 1M ATS tokens will be claimed, yes.  Regards, Peter

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hi, Have you checked our About Us page?  Here's some info about us just in case:  Authorship is run by Serious Reading (SeriousReading.com). They are our parent company, a book marketing agency with thousands of active authors all over the world. Over the years, Serious Reading worked with over 10,000 authors and as of today, they have over 2,500 monthly active authors using their book marketing services.  You can find over 1000 author interview Serious Reading did here: http://seriousreading.com/category/author-interviews Social proof about our company running for several years: https://facebook.com/seriousReadingBooks/  Besides running Serious Reading, we’ve also been successful at building other related platforms. One such example is DotWriter.com, a content writing platform, fully developed and built from scratch by the same team. Today, DotWriter has over 10,000 active writers and been acquired by an important Media company. DotWriter exhibited at all important Digital Marketing & Conferences all over the world (ad:tech New York, RISE Hong Kong, and can be found this September at dmexco in Cologne, Germany).  You can also find a video with our CEO N. Warfield on our About Us page too.  Regards, Peter CDO Authorship.com

Author: Tszunami98
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: On your page it says the price of ATS will be set by the ammount raise in the ICO diveded at the total number of ATS.  for example if you raise 1M$ divided by 100MATS results 0.01...but what does 0.01 mean? Can you elaborate with an example?

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hi, yes the total amount we raise determines how many ATS tokens 1 ETH will offer you.  Example: If we raise $1M which is roughly 3030 ETH, it means 1 ETH invested will give an investor 100,000,000 / 3030 = ~30.000 ATS  Based on our projections and on discussions with investors going to invest (there are many who wait to invest in the last days before the ICO closing date, in order to not have their money stuck doing nothing for long), we expect a raise in the $3-$5 M range. This will mean that an investor will receive between 6000-10000 ATS for 1 ETH.  Our minimum advertised price on the website (1ETH=2000 ATS) is for the situation where we would reach the maximum amount of $15M.  Here's a capture from our website explaining it:    Regards, Peter

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hi, We surely aren't a scam. Let's start from here, since I believe this is why you registered, to call us a scam.  Have you done some basic research about us and our company before?  Our parent company is Serious Reading (http://seriousreading.com), we are in the book marketing business for several years, have thousands of authors who use monthly our services, have thousands of authors who already used our services for years, you can find our Company name on dozens of books.  Here's just about 1000 author interviews our company did: http://seriousreading.com/category/author-interviews , proof we weren't born yesterday.  Here's our Facebook page with over 100,000 followers as well: http://facebook.com/seriousReadingBooks/  Going forward: On our Authorship About Us page (http://authorship.com/about-us/) you can find both our address and a video with the CEO. (From what I remember, scams usually have no address, no team, no past background, no nothing). If you are from Maryland area, you could even meet him in person, in case you may reply "how do I know who that guy is".  About the ICO address, yes, it's not a contract address and this is something many ICOs use instead of a contract. The reason are various, but for our particular case: -unlike ICOs that have an infinite supply of issued tokens, we don't. We have a fixed supply volume. -some ICOs have a predetermined token price. We don't. 1 ETH = 2000 ATS minimum, but it can get higher than this based on the total amount raised. -besides ETH, we also accept credit card and wire deposits. A contract could not handle that. (PS: from what I am aware, scams don't have bank accounts, or credit card merchant accounts either; the idea is that they want to stay as hidden as possible) -a smart contract could have not handled our referral bounty campaign. The free ATS tokens have to be distributed manually. -right about the time when we were deciding if we should go with a contract or an address and how things should be, there were a few instance of exploited contracts and we wanted to make sure we don't risk it.  Now, regarding your other post below about why we don't use Slack, or Reddit.  Why should I? Last time I checked only 3 million people from all around the world used Slack. If we have no need for their project management platform, why should we be forced to use something we currently don't need. Our management system we currently use is just fine, so we won't change our behavior just because someone thinks that platform is better.  As far as Reddit goes, neither me or my team members are active Reddit users, meaning we wouldn't even be allowed to create a subreddit (these are the rules). I admit, reddit has it's uses, but it's not something you see too often in the publishing world. How would having a reddit channel helped our credibility? We are already using this forum, as a public meeting place, for everyone to see and share their thoughts. There are hundreds of posts all over reddit about our company, should anyone really want to find us there anyway.  I understand many ICOs rely on all these free advertising methods to attract investors. Many probably don't have any other option. We personally used our inhouse $250K advertising budget to advertise through Facebook/Adwords , and I dare to say, the results are much better. Most forum members here saw our ads way earlier than this thread (who for most of the time gets buries through the hundred others here).  As such, people who believe in us and our company, are free to join our ICO. Anyone having doubts can wait until the ICO is over and buy our ATS tokens from third party exchanges later.  Regards, Peter CDO Authorship.com

Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Thank you themathiasmiller, that is 100% correct.  Most of the people on that list are known people, with a huge number of followers and lots of influence. Many of them contacted us prior and explained us how they plan to market our ICO.  Since Reddit was referred, there are posts there with hundreds of follow-up comments. There are dozens of Youtube videos explaining our ICO and plenty of blog posts about us. All of these attract genuine visitors.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Info for everyone mentioning they did not receive the 75 ATS tokens either for them or from their referrals.  1. You will receive the 75 ATS for registering AFTER you confirm your email address. A confirmation email will be sent after you register. Please click the confirmation link. If you don't see the confirmation link after a few minutes, check your junk/spam folder.  2. Your referrals need to do the same. You won't be credited extra 75 ATS for referrals that don't confirm their email.  3. Beware: do not share the same computer/IP address with your referrals. This will mark your account as suspicious and both your account and your referral account may be suspended.  Thank you, Peter

Author: A1exander
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: An interesting project. I am an author myself, but it is just a hobby, I do not even try to publish, I put it on the Internet. However, my native language (in which I write) it not English. I have some plans for translating a few of my short stories in the future, but nothing specific yet. Do you have any interest and/or plans for non-English authors and readers?

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hi Alexander and thank you for your message. Translating books to/from a language is an important part of our platform. We won't stop just to English, but to all/most languages.  Here's a screenshot right from our homepage:   Regards, Peter

Author: A1exander
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: That's good. I did a lot of translations of technical texts (manuals and so on) from English and I also tried to translate some SF. As for translating to English, my proficiency with the language is probably not enough for translating fiction, but I am definitely interested in seeing some of my creations in English.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Yes, translating fiction is a different beast as it's more to it than just translating words. Usually it needs an editor to go over the translated version. Most translators team up with one when translating fiction.

Author: A1exander
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Exactly. I hope one day I'll be in such a team, translating my own works and maybe works of some of my friends.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: As I imagined, all your referrals are fake.  Turns out your "referrals" are names like "Johh Smith or "John Taylor" or "John Marick", or simply "Joe" (you surely got a thing for Joe) or when you got bored just "asdasd" and email addresses like "asdasdtasd@gmail.com, asdasdt@gmail.com", "hackforum/hackforumrobot@gmail.com". Also, your proxy also failed as several of them share the same IPs as well.  As I mentioned, we won't be paying for fake referrals and public messages like this one won't make us back down: we'll just confirm it in public.  Regards, Peter

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Thank you for your message.  Regarding the numbers, we also receive contributions through credit card and wire transfers, as mentioned on our website.  9 out of 10 people contacting us to invest are rather new to crypto currencies (we have a large number of authors and readers following us and also several high profile investors. Most of them didn't even know what crypto-currencies are before we announced the Authorship platform) and they prefer/have no alternative to buy ETH (given that in order to buy ETH you'd have to signup with an exchange, then wait for quite a lot of time to get your account verified). Rest assured, we will be providing digitally signed statements, for complete transparency.  Regarding the social account, Serious Reading is our parent company, where we have over 100,000 followers, where authors and readers follow us daily; we used that mostly to market the upcoming Authorship platform. We do also have https://www.facebook.com/authorshipcom/ but weren't that active there (it was used mostly for Facebook Ads) as we focused on what we already had through Serious Reading.  Regards, Peter

Body: Your account was suspended because all your referrers are fake.  You sent us 24 visitors, who resulted with a 100% conversion rate into 24 fake referrers. All with fake generated names and email addresses and with related IPs.  Screenshot proof:    Everyone else trying to cheat us will be suspended as well. The point of our bounty campaign is to share tokens to genuine users, not to waste them on useless fake traffic.  Regards, Peter CDO Authorship.com

Author: bruno222
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hi Peter,  I am willing to invest into your coin, it seems good (well, I don't like much of your servers doing the hard-work of keeping terabytes of private information, buy anyway, still, the whole concept is nice)  I have a question: Why the numbers is not matching on sites below?  http://authorship.com/contribute/  - 572 investors and a total of 471,660 USD who already paid for this ICO  https://etherscan.io/address/0x3aae4da9A22d518996031791D3Bd61f45DEf6aC7 - 93 transactions (which means, a maximum of 93 investors) and a total of $39,987.43 USD.  Why these numbers of investor and total amount are different?  Thank you!

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Thank you for your message.  Unfortunately, there would be no way to host the book files in the blockchain due to the total size. Also, I wouldn't call "private information" things like the book file or cover images as they are meant to be actually shared to readers. But I understand your point.  Regarding the numbers, we also receive contributions through credit card and wire transfers, as mentioned on our website.  9 out of 10 people contacting us to invest are rather new to crypto currencies (we have a large number of authors following us and also several high profile investors) and they prefer/have no alternative to buy ETH (given that in order to buy ETH you'd have to signup with an exchange, then wait for quite a lot of time to get your account verified). Rest assured, we will be providing digitally signed statements, for complete transparency.  Sincerely, Peter

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: UPDATE:  Authorship.com has put aside 1% of the total 100M ATS tokens for our Bounty Campaign.  Official link: http://authorship.com/bounty/  INFO:  Our bounty campaign offers everyone who registers to our email list, for free, 75 ATS tokens worth a minimum of $10.  Once registered, each participant is offered an unique referral link to be shared through social accounts, forum posts/signatures, blog posts, or any other marketing method available to the participant.  For every referral that signups after accessing your link, you will receive 75 ATS tokens, both you and the visitor you referred. Shortly put: the more people you refer to our ICO, the more ATS tokens you will earn. There are no limits to the number of referrals you can send (when/if we reach the 1M tokens limits, the campaign will end and we will announce this public).  The beauty of things: all your have to do is to hand others 75 ATS tokens for Free, in order to receive back 75 ATS tokens yourself!  You are able to see live stats of the amount of tokens you earned, and you’ll receive an email notification immediately after someone registers using your link. Full transparency is extremely important to us!  All earned tokens will be distributed to all participants the moment the crowdsale is over.  For more information please check the BitcoinTalk Bounty Campaign link here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2106727  Sincerely, Peter CDO Authorship.com

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Quote from: NewbCoins on August 17, 2017, 09:00:27 PM you know someone who wear alexander hamilton shirt will find way to scam the people anyway  Looking at your profile, I see your last 20 posts made are ALL about "scam scam scam" through random threads, but anyway, here's my reply for you.  First off: yes, the first 100,000 authors will receive a guaranteed monthly income. This is planned for the first 24 months out of the 20M tokens reserved for this.  At the first stage, it will be the first 100,000 authors who join the platform. At the second stage it will be the first 100,000 authors based on their number of sales, and there are several tiers for the guaranteed earnings received.  Regarding your remark "author even you write bad work nobody like, you still get pay"; yes it's entirely possible. Each author will have the option to feature in his book other books. So, if a reader ends up purchasing another book, by reading that "bad word" as you prefer to refer to, he will end up receiving a small commission. We believe each author can improve on his work, if granted the right motivational tools. And remuneration is the best one.  Now, regarding your "Alexander Hamilton" remark, not sure it's worth commenting. It's clear you never attended a book festival, authors meeting or book launch. You probably would have never even recognized Alexander Hamilton either, if I didn't mention about.  If you have any genuine questions, we'd be happy to discuss, but if you'll keep on acting childish, we'll just ignore you from now on.  Thank you, Peter CDO Authorship.com

Author: ArithmomanicVampire
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: I just skimmed the whitepaper so I may have overlooked this. Where exactly does the blockchain into this (IMO generally interesting) project, and where does it end?  For example, if an author uploads their book, does it get stored in the blockchain, or at your centralised servers? If the former, how do you make sure only paying readers get the book? If the latter, what do you need the blockchain for? Just to encode a smart contract? Where does the contract end and the trust begin?  I need just a short elaboration for a newbie. Thank you!

Author: xyj790204
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: yes this is what i want to ask

Author: Darkoth89
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Sounds awesome, I've started writing so this platform could be awesome, I'm interested in the above queries as well.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Hi, The blockchain won't be used to store the actual book files. It would be pretty much impossible as there would be terrabytes of data given that each book will have several MB. These will be stored on our servers.  On the blockchain will be stored the book information (ex: book title, author, translator, publisher etc. Basically all the important information about the book and the connections between the third parties) and it's primary usage is for the distribution of royalties among the parties involved. That's where trust issues usually arrive and this is what the smart contract will solve. Ex: When a book is sold, the smart contract shares earnings between the author, publisher, translator, print facility and everyone else involved in the book's chain.  Regarding your other question: "how do you make sure only paying readers get the book?" , we will have both desktop and mobile reading apps with a proprietary file format which ensures the book can't be shared outside the app.  Regards, Peter CDO Authorship.com

Author: ArithmomanicVampire
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Thanks for the info. The way I understand it, the main innovation here is that the remuneration chain is made transparent, ensuring fair royalties for authors and translators. Other than that you're basically Amazon/Kindle?  OK, this might work, but I still find your royalty promises of 90% for e-books rather optimistic. Being a publisher/editor is hard work, especially if you don't want to get spammed to death (even Amazon had trouble with spam "authors" gaming the system to get royalties). Will you be editing the works at all before publication?

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Not quite, this is not the only innovation. We want to end monopoly by creating a competing market for publishers and print companies too.  Right now, if you are an author who's using a publisher, you are forced to comply with the publisher's prices and printing options. Through the platform this will change. When someone orders a book, all the registered print companies can outbid themselves to print and ship the book to the reader. This would allow the ones who charge less and are closer to the reader's shipping location to win the print, thus ensuring an overall decreased cost of production. The smart contract will then ensure everyone involved in the chain receives it's fair share of royalties. That's especially important when shipping international; right now the costs to ship a book internationally are higher than the book price itself.  Regarding the 90% for e-books goes, this is mostly true for self-published authors. For authors who use a publisher, they can share royalties based on their own agreement saved into the blockchain.  As far as editing goes, this is not something we plan to do; however, we'll have quality inspection steps before the book gets listed on the platform. Also, once listed, user reviews are something the platform will rely on to spot less wanted books. Should they fall under market standards, they will get removed.  Regards, Peter CDO Authorship.com

Author: Auxilius
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Sounds like a good sound project but there is something that seems quite unrealistic: 50% shares for authors when they publish books. I work in the industry and 50% is far from enough to pay publishers, transporters,  and retailers at once. There is a reason why author rights are capped to 15%. Even people like Rowling don't get much more. Care to explain what is your plan on this? This little detail makes the business model crumble like crumpets in my opinion.

Author: peterauthorship
Title: [ANN][ICO] Authorship - Making the Internet More Free and Accessible For Authors
Body: Thank you for your message. You brought up a very interesting point, something we thought about from the very beginning.  We'll manage to do this by making everyone work together, by creating a market where services like printing and delivery can compete.  Ex: When a reader will order a book, that book doesn't have to be printed and delivered from the publisher's in-house print who may be 1000 miles away from the reader, but, from a local print facility who can be 20 miles away from the reader.  When you start cutting down the transport fees and the monopoly prints, you can start offering the kind of earnings we advertise.  Sincerely, Peter
